Enjoy the hundreds of miles of bike trails, sail on Lake Bde Maka Ska, take the historic trolley just steps away to an outdoor summer concert on Lake Harriet or just enjoy a casual laid-back week/weekend hanging out in one of the coolest cities in the USA.  Locals, including our beloved Prince, have considered Minneapolis one of the best cities in America and a well-kept secret for years.

host.name: Nancy
host.about: An entrepreneur and long time Uptown resident I know all the best kept secrets about this wonderful city. I started the fitness movement in the upper midwest and exercise and a healthy lifestyle are still my priority.   I know the best and the fastest trails that will get you where you want to go. An animal lover and advocate and  I have Moki a rescue dog. I've traveled the world and always love coming back to my beautiful City of Lakes.

amenities: Exercise equipment: free weights, stationary bike, yoga mat, workout bench

detailed_reviews.comments: Everything was great and accommodating during our stay in Minnesota. The communication was on point and we had no troubles while we were there. We were greatful to be in the uptown area and the place provided us a great point of entry into the city. Walking to Uptown was a breeze. Multiple restaurants, thrift shops, and even an Apple store are all in the area. The house is in a very tight knit community so be on your best behavior as to not damage the representation of this fine neighborhood. Multiple people walking dogs, playing outside, and going on runs out front. The walk to Calhoun Lake is also minimal for a great view and exercise opportunities. Would definitely stay again. Thanks Nancy!

Nancy’s place is phenomenal! Her home is cozy and definitely made me feel as if I was at home! The lake is a 5 minute walk away! Uptown is also walking distance! She responds quickly and made sure my family were taken care of at all times! Would definitely come back to stay!
You will not find a better apartment in Uptown.  Believe me I have stayed at many there.  Thanks to Nancy for making the stay even more enjoyable.
This place is excellent in every way.  The host is also extremely helpful and fun.  Do not hesitate to book.
Just right for us.  Everything was comfortable and the apartment clean and spacious.  We'll be back.  Thank you Nancy
Do not hesitate to book this place.  Unless it is the week I want it :-)

I spent a weekend at Nancy's place with my mom and my sisters (and a 10 month old).  While Minneapolis was a little bit of a random location to choose for our girl's weekend, we had absolutely the most amazing time and a lot was due to our stay at Nancy's place.  
Nancy was extremely responsive from the get go and even provided us with a pack 'n play for the baby (which fits perfectly in the closet, btw, which a was a big win!).  Nancy also provided tons of local tips and was able to help us find everything in Minneapolis that we needed.
The place itself is clean and comfortable and in an absolutely perfect location!   We had never been to Minneapolis and we were originally considering staying more downtown, but we are so thankful that we found this place -- it is 2 blocks from the lake, which was amazing for going on walks and enjoying the amazing spring weather.  It is also a few blocks from the Uptown neighborhood with great restaurants, some bars, some shops and a great market - everything we needed was within walking distance.  
We also had a rental car and there was street parking and then we joked that everywhere we wanted to go was a 7 minute drive away...other neighborhoods, restaurants, and parks were all easily accessible by car.
In the end, the location was a perfect jumping off point for our visit and if any of us go back to Minneapolis, I think we would all want to stay at Nancy's place again.
Highly recommend this place for any visit to Minneapolis - great location and great host - this is what Air BnB is all about.

If you are looking for a great place with style, comfort and space, Uptown #1 and #2 are perfect.  Great space.  Wonderful location.  Well thought out.  Has everything you need.  And Nancy.  Wow.  A truly, genuine and welcoming host.

We LOVED Nancy’s place.  It was spotless, comfy, classic, and modern all at the same time.  The location can’t be beat—the neighborhood is so close to Uptown and Lake Calhoun, as well as walking distance from some quaint neighborhood coffee spots. Highly recommend for your stay.
We had a great stay at Nancy's Mid-Century Modern gem of a house!  It's in a charming residential neighborhood with restaurants and stores --and the lake--close by.

We had a wonderful stay at Nancy's place. It was spotlessly clean, the beds and the couch were incredibly comfortable and the location couldn't be beat. We loved being a block away from Lake  Bde Maka Ska. I was worried about off street parking, since I know that area can be very busy, but we had no problem. We were able to park right in front of the house every time. I'm pretty picky, but I had no complaints and would happily stay there again .

See my review for Uptown #2. While the furnishings are different the style and comfort are similarly excellent. Layout is the same. Has more natural light than the downstairs #2 unit as upper units usually do. But the lower one has a lot of light as well! Stay here!! One block from Lake Calhoun, now returned to its original name, Bde Maka Ska, 2 blocks to restaurants and shopping on West  lake street, 3 to LaLa ice cream and other shops on Hennepin. 15 min drive to downtown and airport.

This place is absolute perfection.  It is the epitome of stylish mid-century modern.  I loved the space inside.  The location is incredible - short walking distance to Lake Calhoun and to many neighborhood coffee shops, restaurants, bistros and markets.  The neighborhood was beautiful and safe.  We have stayed at many Airbnbs and this one by far is at the top of our list.  The only drawback was no dishwasher, but honestly, it wasn't that big of a deal at all.  Especially in light of the other amenities.

Nancy is a great host. The apartment was very clean and homey. We were in Minneapolis visiting family and friends and it was the perfect place for us to stay. While visiting family, we also had a “vacation” primarly because of the close location of her house to the lakes, parks, and Uptown shops. Nancy lives next door and is a super host. She was friendly and available if we needed anything. I highly recommend this place!

LOCATION!!!! So perfect! Easy to get to restaurants, coffee shops, the lakes, parks, and everything else. We really enjoyed our stay at Nancy’s house. She was an accommodating host who puts a lot of time and attention into her property. It’s a great space with a location that can’t be beat. We didn’t have difficulty parking nearby on the street which was great. If you’re looking for a beautiful place in a great neighborhood, this is it!
Comfortable beds and plenty of space.
A lovely apartment and a really nice neighbourhood.

We had a wonderful stay; the location was amazing, the house was well decorated, very clean and had everything we needed. The instructions were easy to follow and Nancy’s responses were very quick. Would stay again.

This spot is a total gem. The house is super clean, charmingly decorated and located in an idyllic neighborhood. We will always cherish our (more than a few times daily!) walks to the lake- its such a lovely neighborhood with so much to do within in walking distance, all while remaining on a quiet street. Nancy was totally wonderful and helpful anytime we needed a thing. We would absolutely stay here again and recommend it highly for anyone looking for a cozy, clean place to be home while traveling.

Nancy’s home provides an ideal base for a visit to Minneapolis. The space is comfortably decorated, the beds have great linens, and there is a well equipped kitchen. You can easily walk to shops, restaurants, a grocery store, and outdoor spaces. Top it all off with a hostess who replies promptly to questions and provides great suggestions for restaurants and you have a perfect place to stay in Minneapolis. Look forward to returning soon.
Amazing location, great/responsive host, nice layout. Very baby friendly!  Would definitely go back again.

Nancy’s home was cute and cozy. It is walking distance to all the restaurants and shops uptown Minneapolis has to offer. A beautiful lake and large park with walking paths is also down the street. Nancy was super accommodating and very sweet. I highly recommend this property.

My second stay at Nancy’s and it was as great as the first. Perfectly located for walking to restaurants, grocery store, shops, and movie theatre. Well stocked kitchen, perfectly decorated spaces, and a comfortable bed with good linens. Looking forward to the next time my travels bring me to Minneapolis.

Nancy’s place was awesome and she was a great host! It is walking distance from down town Minneapolis where there is great restaurants and shopping! Definitely a great place to stay with family and recommend staying here!
Wonderful place to stay and wonderful host.

Nancy's home was perfect for our stay. It is in a great area, near Lake Calhoun and the fun Uptown scene; it happened to be a block away from the home of our family we were in Minneapolis to visit. Upon arrival and easy check-in we found an immaculate home! She was very communicative despite being out of town on her own trip and made our visit very easy. If we need a place to stay for future Minneapolis visits, it will be the first home we'd try to reserve. Thank you, Nancy!

Nancy is 5 stars across the board!  She lives next door and was so kind to have a bottle of wine waiting for us and even brought over freshly baked scones in morning.  She was super responsive and provided great recommendations.  The apartment was perfect for us for a long weekend.  We enjoyed the local restaurants and bars, and running around the lake.  Downtown was a quick Uber ride.

Nancy did such a great job making us feel at home and comfortable in her place. It is a great location within walking distance to cute restaurants, grocery store, and the lake. Also, Nancy was a great communicator, easy to get ahold of and very accommodating to our situation. She even made us some scones on our first morning! It was the perfect stay! Thank you Nancy!

We lucked out with this place! In my opinion it is in the most perfect part of Minneapolis, close to the lake, great places to eat and the whole Uptown neighborhood. The house was very comfortable and a lovely place to home base. The beds and the linens were so soft and we slept very well. Nancy we as great and very accommodating. We would love to stay here again when we come back!

Nancy's wonderful place is a short walk to Lake Calhoun and to the many great shops and restaurants of the Uptown area. It's comfortable throughout,with lovely beds, plenty of pillows, towels, and a well-equipped kitchen. Nancy is readily available, quick to respond, and a very friendly and nice person to boot. 5 Stars all around.
Great location
Nancy was very attentive and responsive. Amenities were beautiful, perfectly located and very clean and tidy!

Ten stars!  If I could give more than a mere five stars, I would.  We had a longer than usual stay (two months), and it felt like home.  Nancy was an exceptional host. She was so quick to respond to any questions, she made us freshly baked gluten-free scones, she was just a joy to talk to, spend time with and help us out with anything.  We borrowed a couple bikes and she graciously let us store them in the garage. Honestly, she might be my new favorite person in Minneapolis. The apartment was beautifully decorated (cozy mid-century modern). It was very comfortable for us and our 3-year-old son. We made lots of meals, and it wasn’t a problem not having a dishwasher, it really all worked out just fine. The location was a dream! We walked and biked around the lakes and were so close to so many parks.  This place was the ultimate “score” for our family.  Great restaurants and stores near by made living here very easy and comfortable.  Living in Nancy’s Airbnb for two months in the South Minneapolis area also helped us get very comfortable with a part of town that we now know we want to live in some day, that may not have happened without Nancy’s Airbnb. This is such a fabulous place with a fabulous host, that we hope it’s available this time next summer. We truly feel lucky to have found this gem!!
Great place to stay!    The host is wonderful and makes you feel at home.  Location is perfect and in a quiet neighborhood.   Would definitely recommend!

Very nice place in a very good location. Easy check in and check out (thanks for allowing the late checkout!).  Easy street parking, comfortable beds, overall very comfortable. Clean and nicely equipped.  It is on the first floor and we could hear the person above us walking and could also hear the tv, but it wasn’t really an issue. Safe neighborhood and the lake with a lot of walking trails and bike trails close by also.

Good spot. Excellent location. A bit dated in terms of bathrooms and kitchen but functional 
Hosts were very nice
Great place, great location: very pleased with our stay. Walking distance to Lake and stores in Uptown.
Well appointed by lake and sunsets best mpls neighborhood perfect place will miss it
Fantastic location. Comfy beds and luxurious bedding. Charming and bright. We walked both to lake and uptown.

Nancy was an incredible host and responds ASAP whenever you had a question! Nancy’s home was spotless when we arrived and had all the amenities for a long term stay. Being so close to the lake it was a perfect location. I would recommend staying here it was a lovely home. Thanks Nancy!

This was a wonderful place to stay with everything we needed. The location is amazing- walking distance to Uptown restaurants and just a couple of blocks to the lake. Nancy was super helpful and friendly. We would stay there again without a doubt!
Great place, great host, great neighborhood, can’t ask for much more than that!!
I cannot recommend this place more highly.  The aesthetic, the location, Nancy's hospitality. Do yourself a favor and grab this place if it is available on your visit to the Twin Cities.

We loved everything about Nancy's home. It was clean and cozy. Nancy was very attentive and gave us suggestions on places to go. She told us about the Black Walnut, one of the best bakeries we have enjoyed. Just an overall great experience. We will be back.
Bob and Lisa
Nancy's place was quiet, super clean, roomy,  & very comfortable. We loved being so close to the lakes! The location was perfect for us! Nancy was quick to communicate & was a super host.

We had a lovely stay.  All aspects of booking our stay were flawless.  The property is in a great location.  We enjoyed easy access to biking, walking, Restaurants and shops. Clean and comfortable.  Nancy is nearby and very responsive to any need that may arise.

My boyfriend and I had the best 1 month stay living & working remotely from here!! Nancy is the loveliest host. She was very responsive and accommodating to our needs allowing us to move furniture around and bring an additional desk, monitor and desk chair. Beyond this she has an incredible energy about her so I highly recommend you chat her up! 
The apartment was well curated and spacious allowing us to WFH without feeling cramped. It had a fully stocked kitchen with utensils for all your cooking needs, two bedrooms, a large separate dining room, very comfortable living room and tons of closet/ cabinet space for your things if you happen to be nomading like we were or if you’re traveling with a group. There’s also beautiful light that flows through every area of the apartment throughout the day. 
The location is absolute perfection! We spent most mornings taking a stroll to grab coffee and walk the lake as well as the surrounding blocks. The area feels like a close community that walk their dogs and hang out with their neighbors - a vibe we loved! We were sad to leave and will definitely be back in the future! Thank you Nancy!

Short walk or bike to everything you need. The chain of lakes and bike trails within a block are spectacular. We walked or used  the public share bikes and scooters to get around. 
Nancy's place is more than enough space for  four people. She's a great host and we would rent here again.

This is the home we’ll look for when we visit Mpls again. It was clean, quiet, comfortable and just 1-block away from a gorgeous lake to walk, run, or ride your bike around. Truly exceptional!  Not to mention nearby Uptown with shops, restaurants, you name it, the location is ideal. The home itself is perfect for a couple or small family.  We hope to stay here again.
We had the best stay at Nancy's place over Thanksgiving. It was extremely clean and included everything you need to feel right at home. Plus, the location could not be beat!

Nancy’s place is so well-stocked and cozy & in an amazing walkable location. A smoothie bar and bakery are around the corner and the lake is just a block away.
Some noise from the upstairs neighbors but nothing too bad. This home has a great ambiance and I can’t wait to book again!
The property is in a great location. We loved being so close to the lakes! Nancy was super helpful and friendly. Nancy was an exceptional host. Thank you, Nancy.

We stayed at Nancy’s during our first visit to Minneapolis as a family and it was absolutely perfect. The charming house is a couple of blocks from 32nd st beach, complete with a wonderful playground for our 2 year-old. You’ll be within walking distance of a world-class bakery, restaurants, and grocery stores. If you’re a runner or biker, the nearby lakeside trails are great. Finally, the house is comfortable, stylish, and has a central air for summertime heat. We’ll definitely be back!

We spent a fabulous 8 weeks at this charming Airbnb. The house was spotless, cozy and equipped with everything we needed to enjoy our stay.  Our hosts, Nancy and Cody were available to answer any questions or make recommendations for restaurants and fun local activities. 
We loved the location only one block from the Chain of Lakes walking and biking trails. We walked to a number of great restaurants,, coffee shops and a very delicious bakery. 
Thank you, Nancy and Cody for hosting us in your Airbnb. We highly recommend staying here and look forward to returning again.
This is our second time staying here in the last 4 years. Both times we experienced a very clean environment, great central location and Nancy is a great host.

STAY HERE! Nancy's place is one of those gems that is so great you almost want to hide it and keep it for yourself. But this awesomeness needs to be shared. It's what airbnb is all about. A perfect neighborhood location right off the lake that highlights the best of MN and Minneapolis "the city of lakes". The home is perfectly appointed with beautiful touches throughout. The style is so cool. Easy parking, super fast wifi, full kitchen, and the list goes on. We're MN natives now living in FL but travel home often and so we can say with authority, stop your search, you've found the best place to stay in the twin cities! We'll be back! Oh, and impulse juice co is 2 blocks away and has the best açaí bowls we've ever had.

I loved my time here , the home is smack dab in the heart of a fantastic community with character and charm ! 
The house is clean and feels like home with all the amenities you will need . 
My family was so impressed with the comfort and charm of this place ❤️
Nice quiet, clean place to work and rest. Loved that it was so close to the lake. Beautifully decorated. Lovely neighborhood.
Great location, comfortable place, super responsive, and flexible host.
Quiet location, convenient to walking the lake, good cafes and restaurants, easy parking. Basically we’d love to return.

Everything about Nancy’s place was great! We felt right at home with all of the attention to detail when it came to the amenities, cleanliness, and communication from the host. The location can't be beat! If you’re considering booking, you won’t regret it :))
This place was perfect for our family of 3. We LOVED walking down to lake and enjoyed the beach and playground. The unit itself was spotless and comfortable.
Great little duplex in the heart of uptown! It’s a classic south Minneapolis home, with tons of character. The neighborhood is very walkable, and the lake is only a block away!

Nancy was an excellent host- friendly, communicative and the place was just as described. The space was very clean and perfect for our group of 3. Parking was easy right out front and we enjoyed walking to the different lakes and local restaurants and coffee shops. Would highly recommend and come back in a heartbeat!

We absolutely LOVE to stay at Nancy’s place when we’re in Minneapolis! This was our 2nd stay here and we plan to stay again. We feel at home in this just the right size home — not too big or too small. We love the space, the decor, amenities, and the LOCATION — one block off Bde Maka Ska (Lake Calhoun) and walkable to shops & restaurants. Nancy and Cody go above and beyond to make us feel at home and have everything we need. 🙌🏼
Thank you for everything Nancy & Cody!!! We’ll see you again!  😎😎

My fiancée and I came to Nancy’s Airbnb in Uptown hoping to get a sense of what living in Minneapolis would be like, as well as having easy access to the beautiful Lake Bde Maka Ska and adjacent lakes. Overall the location itself was perfect, a few minutes walk from the heart of Uptown with easy access to the Midtown Greenway, and a short bike to Downtown areas like the North Loop. Nancy’s Airbnb was immaculately clean, with nicely placed labels and clear directions to help find things and know where to put things on our way out. We absolutely loved staying here and was a perfect impression of the city.

Nancy's place was a great place to stay while visiting family.  The kitchen was equipped with everything I needed to bake for a family gathering and the living space was perfect for lounging.  Moreover, the apartment is within walking distance of two lakes and many restaurants.
Nancy was a wonderful host, very helpful and responsive. The house was very clean and in an excellent location.  Very close to the lakes, cafes, and restaurants. I would happily stay here again.
The hosts were responsive, direct and generous. This was a great spot for our family and our fido!

Nancy's place was exactly what I needed! If you're looking for peace and quiet, a beautiful place with everything you need, comfy bed and stunning surroundings, then look no further! Nancy and Cody were so helpful and kind, and you couldn't ask for a better place to relax, work, walk to the lake, go boating, find fabulous food and enjoy the calming spirit of this place. Thanks for everything, Nancy. Can't wait to return! :)

The home was beautiful and clean. We enjoyed the location, which was within walking distance of the lake, grocery stores, and restaurants. Communication with Nancy was quick and easy. We would definitely stay again if we were traveling to the Minneapolis area.

A wonderful 10-day visit to Minnesota.  Location near that lakes was exceptional with abundant walking opportunities, kayaking, and fishing.  The interior was perfect for our family with abundant light and tasteful interior design.  Very much enjoyed the neighborhood with exceptional restaurants, a great blowing alley with noteworthy happy hour and carintas tacos, fresh baked croissants at Black Walnut, and a well-appointed local bookstore all within walking distance.  In fact, we did not rent a car for this trip and did not miss it.  Thank you Nancy ad Cody!

Beautifully decorated, spotlessly clean, close to so many wonderful shops and (delicious!) restaurants, comfy beds, and two blocks from the lake… we hated to leave! The neighborhood is gorgeous and so walkable, too. This is a gem.

Wonderful neighborhood, one block from the lake, with restaurants and market within walking distance. The apartment makes you feel at home. Spot clean, with comfortable bed. Living room is cozy and welcoming. We will return.

Absolutely loved my stay! It was so cozy, well appointed and quiet! I visited both nearby lakes. Black Walnut was delicious! The bus was 30 minutes away and easy to get to. I didn’t have a car and it was no problem. The grocery store was 10 minutes away. Such a cute neighborhood! I would absolutely stay again.

Nancy's place was an ideal home base for visiting family in the area. This street level flat was spacious, perfectly clean, well furnished and supplied, and has a great layout with living areas in the front and quiet bedrooms in the back. We loved the meticulously restored midcentury bathroom, trim and cabinets. Location is very nice, with the walk around the lake, groceries and uptown commerce, and lots of quiet residences all around. Ideal. While upstairs neighbors were quiet and appropriate, light sleepers might be disturbed by the sounds of feet, creaks, and plumbing. We thought the cleaning fee was a bit steep, but overall this rental is highly recommended!

Nancy’s home really captures the spirit of Minneapolis: friendly folks, walkable to the lake and tasty food nearby. The unit itself is the downstairs of a duplex and squeaky clean with gorgeous hardwood floors and the vintage charm of all your grandmother’s home that felt like magic when you were young with modern amenities. It was the perfect jumping off point to explore the city; no where was more than a 15 minute drive. We enjoyed Barbette and Owamni while in town and both were impeccable meals. We enjoyed being close to the lake and some really wonderful coffee spots. The neighborhood felt safe, parking was easy to find. We were also pleased to see so many Pride flag in the neighborhood and it was comforting to know if we needed something Nancy lives next door. She was warm and responsive.
We really enjoyed the location and quietude of the space.  Everything was clean and cozy.   the location is very walkable and we enjoyed runs around Bde Maka Ska!

We visited at the end of February, beginning of March. We arrived. They had about 9 in of snow. Walking in the area was really not possible for us as we are in our golden years 😉.  But the neighborhood is lovely, and Nancy responded he immediately with somebody who came over and shoveled the sidewalk for us. It's a little bit awkward to have to mow your vehicle twice and not be able to park on the front street because of snow plows... That's not an insurmountable challenge! The house itself is darling, and Nancy has done a swell job with furniture and decorating. There was every single thing we needed in the kitchen and bathroom, and we certainly enjoyed our stay here.. some of my ratings were less than five stars, maybe because although we were told this was a pet friendly Airbnb, once we arrived We went over the owners very detailed instructions that she had left for us, and found out we were not allowed to use the patio with our dog. This was my only complaint/ concern.

name: Clean comfortable one bedrom
description: This stylish place to stay is perfect for couples or individuals travelling for work trips. Situated outside of Minneapolis city center makes a perfect quite location. The entire apartment complex is a NO SMOKING ZONE.

host.name: Sammy
host.about: Friendly

detailed_reviews.comments: Very nice place! It was clean, organized, and he was very responsive!
This place is very comfortable and clean, quiet, easy to find, all amenities as described. I definitely would come again.

name: Lake Nokomis Disco Duplex
description: Our Airbnb is nestled in the vibrant & historic neighborhood of South Minneapolis. Just a short walk to Lake Nokomis where you can rent paddleboards, kayaks or swim at the beach. Starbucks, Lunds Grocery, a liquor store, and fantastic restaurants are all within walking distance. We’re just 10 minutes from the Mall of America and MSP International Airport. Located on a lively, busy street. Private entrance in a duplex. Enjoy your own space while we’re next door to maintain a neat & tidy property.

amenities: Coffee maker: drip coffee maker, Keurig coffee machine

detailed_reviews.comments: Sannas home was fabulous everything we were looking for to celebrate our anniversary. Place was clean and decorated beautifully. Sanna was very thoughtful in every detail even left us a happy anniversary card and a bottle of wine. We will definitely be back! Highly recommend you won’t be disappointed!

Love staying here! Everything we wanted to do was relatively close which was awesome, I loved the walkable restaurants. The space is perfect for two people and was super relaxing, everything we were looking for the weekend!
The place was exactly what I was expecting. Great location for walking to cafes and bars.

Sanna was extremely responsive and helpful. She was an excellent host. It was extremely cold outside and the heater had an issue so she brought 2 auxiliary heaters to make sure the house stayed warm. She had a person coming to fix the heater first thing the next day, so I'm sure it is already fixed. 10/10 would stay at Sanna's place again.

The place was perfectly cozy in every way, and the owner was incredibly kind and helpful when it came to suggesting things to do in the area and offering to accommodate our needs. Would definitely recommend it to anyone who enjoys a convenient and hassle free stay in Minneapolis.
Great location and place to stay when visiting the twin cities. Sanna is wonderful host and extremely helpful!

Cozy Cottage. Hot tub was a nice treat! Host was very nice and helped us find the Super Bowl on the TV. No microwave, however there is a nice gas stove in the kitchen. We had nice weather, we walked to the Cedar Inn, they have great beer & wings!

This place was great place to stay and Sanna responsiveness made the whole experience that much better. Sanna and Nick even provided my girlfriend and I a little love letter game (in Valentine's day fashion) which we absolutely loved. Overall great place, great hosts, and great experience, would definitely book again.
my boyfriend and I had a great time! we felt at home Sanna was very friendly! She left some trea6for my service dog (she says thank you) the location was awesome!
Extremely accommodating and quick to respond.

Sanna is an incredible host and the place was such a great find! The Lake Nokomis area is a great neighborhood to stay in while visiting Minneapolis. There are lots close restaurants that are walkable or just a short drive - Sanna has a ton of excellent recommendations. The property is fantastic, it is clean, charming, and has lots of character.

This was the best Airbnb and I couldn’t recommend it enough. They were so friendly, the place was beautiful, and it was in the perfect location being so close to everything we wanted to do! Staying here was definitely one of the many highlights of our trip!
Host did a wonderful job making this a wonderful place to spend spring break!

1. Reasonable price for a 1B1B private space
2. Quiet and safe environment 
3. Easy for calling Uber
Sanna kept the place clean and was prompt with responses and clarifications
My mom and I loved this place! Sanna had great recommendations on food near by and shops. Definitely will be booking again when I want another getaway to the city! 😌
Had an amazing stay here with my best friend, place was nice and fairly spacious. Hosts were friendly and recommended some amazing places during our visit. Would definitely book again.
very clean and nice host 100% recomended.
We had a very enjoyable and comfortable stay.

Sanna’s place was extremely easy to find and so cute and cozy! It looked exactly like the pictures. She is minutes away from the Mall of America, a super easy drive right up the road. She’s also in walking distance to great coffee and food. I wish it had been nicer weather so we could have done some hiking around the nearby lakes and parks! I personally loved the music themed decor throughout the house, and Sanna was more than helpful when we had some issues locking up during the day. She even came out when we returned to make sure we got back inside with no issues. My daughter wants to come back to Minneapolis someday and we would definitely book here again! Would also be a great place for a couple’s retreat!
Very nice place close to many of the popular places in the city!

This is a great location close to the airport and beautiful parks around Minneapolis, but my check in was an issue. 
The directions I received from the host gave me two different log in codes and neither of them worked. 
I messaged on Air b n b but there was no response for a half an hour. I was standing in the Minnesota cold for thirty minutes after traveling 4+ hours from the west coast. I had to reach out to Air b n b to get the host's direct contact information. When I texted,  her response was prompt and I was able to get in.
Later that night, I  went to shower and the hot water ran out after about three minutes. It was late, so I decided to wait to let my host know about the issue. It got fixed when I reported it to her the next day, but it was not a great check in experience to say the least.

We visit Minneapolis for the occasional doctor appointment at the University of Minnesota. Sanna and Nick have such a cute and comfy little place that I’ll be booking again in the future if it’s available when we stay again! It very central to many different attractions in the area. I think most we ever drove was 13 minutes.
Great place to stay and close to some awesome spots.

Sanna quickly responded to any requests. I am recovering from foot surgery as well as several fractured vertebrae, so I particularly appreciated that she provided a wedge when I explained the situation and asked for additional pillows. The house is on a busy street and near the airport, but I never had any problems with getting or staying asleep as she thoughtfully provided a white noise machine.

Sanna’s place is wonderful. Very clean, arty and comfortable decor, cute historic neighborhood within walking distance of shops, a grocery, parks, restaurants. Good access public transportation, too. Sanna was a very responsive host and shared excellent recommendations on places to visit. Would stay here again 💯

Sanna was very welcoming and the space is cute and quirky. The beds are comfortable and the host was very responsive! She also shared some great recommendations for activities and places to eat which we greatly appreciated.

This was a wonderful place to stay. Sanna was a great host. The home was easy to find, check in instructions were clear, and the place was clean. It was exactly what we needed. I was able to park on the street right in front of the house. There are lots of places within walking distance. I recommend this place and would stay again!
Central location, clean and easy to access.
Really cute area and very cozily decorated! My best friend and I felt right at home and relaxed for our stay! 😊
Place was immaculate.  Bed was very comfortable.
Overall, we were very pleased. Grocery and dining out options within walking distance. One consideration: Weather may impact how you feel about the parking situation.

Everything went great!  Sanna had awesome local recommendations and was very helpful.  Definitely not a bad thing for our experience, but I will say the walls are thin between the separate units.  I was never bothered by it and thankfully had an older child with me so didn’t feel like we were disruptive.  I would have felt bad if I had rambunctious kiddos or a baby, but definitely not an issue for our stay at all!  Appreciate all the communication and help for our long stay!

Good location, easy to walk to parks, restaurants and grocery store.  Unit was clean with tasteful furnishings.  Host was very responsive.  We had a comfortable stay.  Kitchen had limited cooking supplies and dishware.
Fantastic stay.  Tidy. Homey.  Easy to love.  Will be back!
Nice neighborhood,  easy parking,  close food options, good access to other amenities.   We had one problem of our own making, and Sanna fixed it immediately.
Sanna was great with suggestions for local restaurants and places to go. I would definitely stay here again if I’m ever in the area again.
We had a wonderful time staying at Sanna’s Disco apartment! Clear instructions for check in & check out. Loved the quiet neighborhood!

Amazing stay. Within walking distance of Lake Nokomosis, gas station, coffee, you name it! Wonderful peaceful neighborhood. We didn't want to leave. Will definitely be staying here again if we ever find ourselves in Minneapolis again.
Sanna's place was a dream to stay in. Above average communication, great decore (especially for music lovers). Excellent recommendations for surrounding food and drinks.
Cute place! Great vibes there. Super responsive host.

The house was exactly as described and what we needed for our quick visit to see our granddaughters. 
Parking was not an issue. Great recommendations for places to go and restaurants.
Fantastic apartment.  Will certainly stay again when I visit Minneapolis.
Great spot to stay in Minneapolis, a fun little home with a great host

Great location, incredibly easy to park and access, walkable area with parks nearby! Sanna was quick to respond to any questions we had and provided very clear instructions. Comfortable home with everything we needed to cook and feel at home!

Sanna's place was great! We'd absolutely stay here again. It was clear that a lot of care, and attention to detail went into making the space feel comfortable and stylish. We also forgot something and Sanna reached out to us directly right away so we were able to pick up that item before leaving Minneapolis. 10/10 recommend!

This is a fantastically comfortable and convenient place to stay. Kind and responsive host, walking distance to beautiful parklands, convenient access to grocery store and cafes. I had no trouble parking right out front on the street. Well equiped kitchen, comfortable bed and great tub!

Place was just as described. Sanna was extremely helpful. The house is older with squeaky floorboards so I was paranoid of making noises walking around at night, but otherwise the place and location was perfect and exactly what I needed for my trip. I loved the decorations and would def stay again.

wonderful place to stay! the neighborhood is absolutely gorgeous, very peaceful, and full of nature. the road is a bit busy but not bothersome. the home is easy to assess and find. a comfortable stay overall. a bit of a creaky house but still nice.

This is NOT a two bedroom place. It has two beds. Not sure how there would be room for people to comfortably sleep in the one bedroom with two beds. Other than that House was cute and clean and the neighborhood was great.
Sanna was very responsive! We had a great time.

I really enjoyed staying in this home (one bedroom duplex or half a house) for 8 days, 7 nights.
Everything was neat and cozy and there were good instructions and timely communications with the host. 
The location was great with a grocery store (Lunds), restaurants, and good walking nearby.  A laundry mat is a few blocks in the other direction.  Cedar Ave is a busy commuter road, and parking is on the street.  But Minneapolis drivers are used to people waking, biking, blading, etc., and strive to be courteous. 
The host had flowers and a nice note on the table for me, since I was visiting the city to retrace my steps with my husband and his (our) family during the first anniversary of my husband  “going ahead.”
The host kindly made up the trundle bed for my sister in law to stay 2 nights.  
The host also had coffee, creamer, tea in the kitchen; and lotion, body wash, shampoo, and conditioner in the bathroom; and a hair dryer in the linen closet. 
I certainly recommend this place!
Great location for our visits to family. Quiet and safe space.

It was a great experience here! It was my first time visiting and Sanna made sure to write a long list of fun restaurants and activities to do during my visit! Very homey place with many walkable restaurants and things to do. There was also recommendations on the fridge, which was amazing! Bedding/ linens were offered, and nice big bed was amazing!

Beautiful neighborhood of unique houses in Minneapolis. We enjoyed a walk along the nearby creek. We also walked to a coffee shop. We spent a lot of time just chilling and reading on the gorgeous blue velvet couches with the heat up nice and warm. It’s a duplex, and the owner is in the other half, although we didn’t actually meet. There was shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and lotion. There was also a kurig with coffee and some tea.
Sanna and Nicholas' place was very cozy and had everything we needed!  It was located in the perfect place between all the Twin Cities activities we wanted to do, too!

Sanna's place is wonderful and I would highly recommend it. The bed is so comfortable and the kitchen nicely stocked with cooking needs. Their is a great TV with good access to streaming apps. The location is great with restaurants, coffee, and groceries within walking distance. I will definitely rebook with Sanna.

We had a great stay. Everything was spotlessly clean and well-organized. The location was convenient, being close to the Mall of America and downtown, making it easy to explore the area. The eclectic decor was interesting, and the large living room was a nice touch. The bedroom was decent-sized, but the bathroom was small and walls were a bit thin, making it easy to hear neighbors, though they were generally quiet.
Overall, for the price point it was a great deal and we would stay again.

Had the BEST time at Sanna & Nick’s place! Their home was the cutest and incredibly clean. Coffee, food and groceries all within walking distance too! On top of that, the hosts were very responsive and even provided several local recommendations for food and things to do :)

Second time here.
Will do again if available.
Awesome stay! It was super cozy and the hot tub was a nice touch. Nice neighborhood and close to everywhere we wanted to go! Also, the bed is SUPER comfortable. Thank you!!!!
Sanna's place is a lovely spot. while we didn't get to utilize the hot tub this trip we'd gladly stay again. and what wonderful decor!

All around great place to stay. Fairly quiet, nice neighborhood, and friendly hosts. 
Some stricter rules than expected on some amenities, but otherwise fabulous!

Beautiful place! 
Sanna had a great list of local recommendations and very easy to communicate with. Worth the money for the place and the area!
Sanna and Nick were amazing hosts. The home was clean, and comfortable for our mom’s weekend away. The hot tub was a perfect relaxation piece for us too.
Cute space. Well stocked kitchen to cook.

Very clean place with awesome decorations and great hosts. Everything that was listed was there for us to use. Very close to all the places we visited while here! We would totally come again. Very lovely and full of character house!
Really nice and helpful! Such a beautiful area to stay at!
We had a lovely stay! Prompt and kind communication. Cozy and clean space. Beautiful neighborhood, with lots of local attractions 🩵
We had a wonderful time in Minneapolis and this home was perfect for us. Thank you so much!

I had a wonderful stay at Sanna's place. It was clean, comfortable, and stylish. The location is amazing with lots of interesting things to do within walking distance. Sanna was very responsive and made sure I had everything I needed.
Great location!

Very cute little house, great location in south Minneapolis. The bed was very comfortable, and I appreciated little touches like the sound machine on the nightstand. As I was getting into town I realized I forgot to bring mine, and thought I’d have to run out and buy one, and was relieved that I could instead just settle in and relax. 
Also, in a world of soulless gray and white airbnbs decorated with off-the-shelf Walmart art, I appreciate any host that imbues their space with real character. This place is furnished and decorated in a way that fits the style and age of the home, while reflecting the personality of the person who put it together. Staying here feels genuinely comfortable, rather than feeling like just a place to sleep for the night.
Would highly recommend to anyone checking out the twin city area.

What a charming little space! From the velvet couches to the wall art to the kitchen towels, this airbnb is filled with charm and whimsy and  decorated to delight. It had everything we needed and is located in one of our favorite Mpls neighborhoods, walking distance from ie, one of our favorite restaurants. Sanna and Nick are super responsive (and love the neighborhood as much as we do)-- they shared their suggestions for things to do and see and eat and we felt well cared for.

Just the right size for two people and a long weekend. Living area is roomy with a very nice large screen TV and comfortable furnishings. Great for relaxing after a day with grandkids! Kitchen has coffee maker, microwave, stove and oven! Pretty street in a quiet neighborhood.   House is older, but very clean and presentable.  Would rent here again.

name: Urban Cyclist's Dream/Global Market
description: If you love bicycling, walking, or the city, you'll love it here!  Our home overlooks the Midtown Greenway, an old 1882 rail>to>trail connecting the Mississippi River to 5 lakes and the 100 year old Grand Rounds National Scenic Byway 50+ mile trail system, nominated for inclusion on the National Register of Historic Places featuring lakes, woodlands, wetlands, playgrounds, golf courses, and  historic bridges.  So come see why "Mary Tyler-Moore" was set in this beautiful 'City of Lakes' :0)

neighbourhood.overview: An urban setting with the Midtown Global Market and the Midtown Greenway create a uniquely diverse community full of life in the city of lakes. Our townhouse/condo overlooks the Midtown Greenway and is connected to the Midtown Global Market where Sears began in 1905.

host.name: Dan & Debby
host.about:
My wife and I grew up in Minneapolis and now live back here after spending some time in NYC.  We consider Minneapolis the "Mini-Apple".  We love the city and feel blessed to live in 2 of the greatest!   

Both of us work for a non-profit organizaton that assists churches/ministries that reach out to the poor and marginalized of the inner cities of America.   

We enjoy many outdoor activities like biking, skiing, walking/running, etc. but most of all, connecting with people. Many of those things happen right outside our door!

We have 3 children that have all graduated from high school.  One just graduated from college and one is just entering college.  So proud of them!

We hope you will enjoy our city as much as we do!!
Be still,
Dan (& Debby)

amenities: Exercise equipment: free weights, yoga mat
Clothing storage: walk-in closet and closet
Paid parking garage on premises – 50 spaces
60 inch HDTV with Apple TV, Fire TV, Roku, DVD player

detailed_reviews.comments:
Wow! We had a wonderful time.  The condo was comfortable, clean and in a very diverse area.  We felt safe and very secure in this aera. Dan and Debby were excellent hosts.  The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in.  

Dan and Debby left a booklet of things to do in the area, personal size toiletries,  menus from local eating places.  They even had our name and photo on the key ring.  

You will not find a better better place to stay.  

The area was diverse, global market within walking distance.  Just a short drive, or bus trip away there were many walking/biking trails.  Mall of America is nearby as well.  

Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful.  Thank you Dan and Debby. 

Rodney and Theresa

My family and I spent a long weekend in Minneapolis and stayed at Dan and Debby's home. The home was very well equipped and well located. We enjoyed having the Global Market so close and found the city's public transportation easily accessed. We had a great time and found Dan and Debby very helpful and easy to work with.

We LOVED staying here!  It was a great location, provided the comforts of home, and was amazingly quiet too!  The location allowed us to easily travel to the Mpls area and St Paul area.  We loved all the amenities of the house - 1 1/2 baths, great kitchen, laundry room, and upstairs sleeping rooms.  As a family of five, the space was wonderful.  The hosts were so gracious and prepared for our arrival with towels, linens, restaurant and attraction recommendations, and detailed instructions for the house.  Communicating with our hosts was effortless as well.  This was our first experience with airbnb.com and we could not have been more pleased with the outcome.

We had a great time at Dan and Debby's lovely condo.  They're home is neat and modern and having the Global Market across the street was really great when trying to figure dinner out with two cranky kids in tow at the end of the day.  Dan and Debby were very communicative and lovely to deal with.

The condo met our needs in every possible way.  We needed to stay for 30 days and Debby and Dan willingly accommodated us.  They were gracious and caring hosts.  Upon our arrival, they welcomed us into their home and showed us all the features.  The condo was extremely clean, well-equipped and nicely decorated.  The mid-town location was ideal in that it was close to shopping, bike trails, and public transportation.  We had free access to the fitness center at the Sheraton hotel along with Wi-Fi, cable and Apple TV.  We strongly recommend this attractive condo to everyone – we definitely will return.

name: Mother-in-law apt w/steam shower
description: Escape to this fantastic basement apartment in picturesque St Paul. Close to U of St. Thomas, Macalister college, the airport and the soccer stadium, sandwiched between St Paul and Mpls. This serene retreat offers a living room with a murphy bed and 1 sofa bed and a steam shower for two, perfect for unwinding after a day of exploring. With amenities like board games, puzzles and movies guests will feel right at home. Kickback, relax, and enjoy everything St. Paul and our house has to offer.

detailed_reviews.comments: Inez place is exactly as advertised! it's quiet, great area and plenty of street parking. tons of games to play and movies to watch. we loved it so much we stay another night! I highly recommend this place!!

this was our second time staying here!! love it! highly recommend this place! clean, tons of movies and games! the bathroom had everything you could think of. everything you could think of that you'd want is here. small kitchette with air fryer and convection oven , perfect!! please please if you are staying in St Paul, MN you have to stay here!! great place for a great price!! will be staying here again next time we are in town! thanks again Inez for your amazing hospitality!!
Everything was great!

This place is a homely haven. 
As you descend down the stairs, you get the feeling you are entering a special place. And it is! Spacious, neatly organised and peaceful. Everything is set in place place, functional and well labelled for self service. 
The host, Inez, is very hospitable, super responsive and resourceful!
I will be staying there next time I visit MSP!
Quiet, comfortable, small space.  I'd stay here again.
Super good place to stay and owners were super proactive about making sure our stay was comfortable, good stay as a first time booker!!

We enjoyed the easy access to the space and the location was ideal for our needs - a few miles from the airport and close to the university area. We enjoyed the coffee provided and the comfy bed. Will stay again, soon!

Inez was a responsive helpful host who made us feel at home. The space is very organized. Labels and instructions are well done. The bathroom is luxurious! We stayed on a cold winter day, so the heated toilet seat, heated bathroom floor, towel heater, and steam port in the shower were so welcome! The sleep number type bed was very comfortable. The space isn't overly big, but it worked well. Inez has it noted, this is a pull down, Murphy type bed. A very comfortable bed I might add. It is also noted, but their are stairs to get down to the space. There was plenty of parking on the street, we had several spots right in front of the house to choose from, and we have a bigger vehicle. The space is very well decorated, lots of really great games and movies as well. There are a few little spots of unfinished basement peaking out here and there, but with the totally amazing bathroom, great decor, and super comfy bed, we will be back!

I've now stayed at Inez's place more than once, and I will continue to stay there when I visit St. Paul.  She is a wonderful host and her place is extremely comfortable and very well maintained.  Thoughtful instructions, plus easy check in, make this Air B&B a fantastic choice.

This was the third time I've stayed here and I'm continually impressed with the thoughtful touches of this space.  From the warm bath towel, to the bidet, to the bathroom lights that start out dim and gradually brighten, I constantly impressed with the amenities that make me look forward to staying here during my trips to St. Paul.  Those things, combined with the friendliness of Inez (your host), this Air B&B has become my go-to spot when I visit the Cities.
Great communication, safe and quiet neighborhood. A great place for my overnight in Saint Paul

Lovely place! Bathroom was luxurious and pristine, couch and bed are very comfy. We were too tired to take advantage of all the suite's cool puzzles and board games or stroll the charming neighborhood, but hopefully next time. Host was very kind and yet also gave us total privacy. There is a dog living upstairs but it is such a good dog there was zero noise. Parking was easily found. There was tasty coffee supplied- loose grounds not pods. I was very pleased to see many little "green" choices like that. And as always we were blown away by how delicious the water is in Twin Cities LOL! Really a perfect experience.
Lovely place. Great stream shower. Wonderful bidet! A little noisy, but you are in the basement of house. Comfy bed and nice seating area. Changing the colors on the fireplace is fun.
Inez’s retreat was exactly what we needed and more! So comfy and nostalgic, plus an excellent layout that optimizes the space. We loved it!

Our stay at Inez’s place was great. It is the basement of her house, with a private entrance along a path to the side. Bathroom was really nice - it was heated and toilet & shower were pleasant surprises!
We had an awesome stay over Mother’s Day weekend. Inez was a very responsive and kind host. She responded to texts very quickly. We hope to visit again!
"Inez's house is a great place for two or three people to stay. There are plenty of board games to enjoy! Also, it is in a safe community and close to stores.
Wonderful home in a beautiful area. We LOVED the steam shower. Would stay again!

Great place to stay and great host! I was booking last minute on a trip back to town to finish a move. I was checking in late and Inez was quick and easy to communicate with and had the place ready for me when I arrived. Very comfortable amenities, would stay here again! Also a great location with a fantastic barbershop at the end of the street on Fairview. Thank you!
The space was clean, peaceful, quiet and matched the description. I would definitely visit again.

name: NEW - Cute, Cosy and Convenient Cottage Conversion
description: Close to everything the Twin Cities has to offer, this cute, 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom cottage conversion is nestled in a quiet, leafy neighborhood, minutes from downtown Minneapolis. It's just a few blocks walk from the Mississippi River, where a bike and running path will take you to the city, or down the river to Minnehaha Falls. The house is cosy and well equipped - with a basement media set up that features surround sound, a video game console, and games. A perfect place to relax and connect.

host.name: Kristopher
host.about:
Hi, my name is Kris and I'm an Aussie.  I now live between San Pancho, MX, and Minneapolis, USA, with my wife and son. I work in marketing and my wife is a consultant in the non-profit, arts & community world.  

We're very respectful of our surrounds and neither of us smoke. We both surf, and are into fitness, live music, dancing, and good, streaming video. We live simply, and to travel.  Our passports are our most treasured possessions.

detailed_reviews.comments: Check in and check out went very smoothly. The place was clean and had all we needed for a successful stay. We would definitely stay again!
We enjoyed our stay at The Cottage. It was very spacious, with the separate built out basement area.  Neighborhood was quiet and peaceful.  Will definitely stay here again!
Great stay!
Quaint house with great design features. Maximized the space. Thank you.

Family friendly, quiet and peaceful neighborhood. Feels away from the hustle and bustle of city life. It was perfect for our son and nephew to hang out, watch a movie and play together. Great spot to rest our heads and have game nights after exploring the science museum and MOA for a quick little weekend. The house is super cozy and cute with great history. I would highly recommend this cottage for a quiet, peaceful spot after some twin city exploring.
Such a cute, clean home.  perfect for three girlfriends staying together for the weekend in Mpls.
Perfect place for my family. We love the neighborhood. The house is lovely with lots of nice touches like a yoga mat.
loved the location
Home worked perfect for us. Had 5 adults staying, was spacious and comfortable. Easy access to University campus and surrounding areas.
Cute and clean little house in an inviting neighborhood close-ish to UM campus and downtown that works well for a weekend.

We had a great experience here. It’s a short walk to the river and trails, along with a cute cafe within walking distance. It’s a short driving distance to the university, downtown, and about 30 minutes from Mall of America. We felt very comfortable in the house and would stay here again
Charming home in lovely neighborhood a short walk from the Mississippi river

Kristopher’s cottage was the perfect home base for my parents and in-laws who came to support us as we brought a new baby home in the second half of January. We also very much appreciated the host’s responsiveness and kindness (e.g. in letting my in-laws check in two hours early after an international flight).
Great house. Very clean. Great parking. Kitchen had everything we needed. Would definitely stay again. Great communication. Always quick to respond. Thank you!
We loved the Cottage. It was exactly what we needed: pristine clean, super comfy beds, fluffy towels, well appointed kitchen, charming decor, easy access, quiet street. Perfect!
Very responsive host! Beautiful home!

This house is really “cute, cozy, and convenient”!Perfect for our stay. Kitchen very complete. Beds very comfortable. Home tidy and clean! It was an easy drive to university aquatic center (we were there for Big 10 swimming and diving), close to nice restaurants and an easy drive to the airport. If back in Minneapolis we would rent this home again.
Great location and place to relax and spend time with friends, close to the downtown area by uber. Beautiful home, all the amenities you could dream of!
Home was very comfortable and in a nice area. It was the most expensive we have stayed at in that zip code, but very nice and worth the privacy.
Great stay in a great location.  Close to good coffee, food and U of M

The cottage was clean and convenient.. located a short 8 minute drive from U of M. The layout of the house was a bit unexpected... the main living room had no TV and wasn't set up for relaxation. The downstairs entertainment center was confusing to use and wasn't intuitive for streaming. The bathrooms were updated. The kitchen was well stocked. Overall, it was a solid stay, we just wish the house setup was more conducive for gathering. We also did not hear from the host at all during our stay... to be fair... we didn't need anything. However, it felt odd and when we left i sent a message early in the morning that we were leaving and didn't get a response until many hours later. If you need a clean place to sleep near U of M, book it. If you're looking for a central place to gather with friends and family.... this might be a little tricky for you.
Great place to stay.   Convenient to shopping and great restaurants.   Comfortable beds.  Would like mirrors in bedrooms for putting on makeup and getting ready.

Kristopher's place is in a great spot. This worked well for our weekend with family in town and being close to many things, while having a comforting spot to retire to in the evenings. Everything went very smoothly and we appreciated that Kristopher was very accommodating to our group.
We stayed with my 80+ year old parents and we were all very comfortable! A well-stocked kitchen and great location.

This house had everything and more. we cooked breakfast one morning and the kitchen is stocked with everything you could ever need. The house was clean, accommodating and  very homey. Everything was no longer than 15-20 min ride share drive away. I would definitely stay here again. Kristopher was so flexible and responsive. We had an amazing time!

This is my first experience in securing an Airbnb!  I was drawn to it because of the location to where my son’s wedding was taking place. I was also drawn to the fact that I would have a house for myself and my guests vs. sharing.
The house is very clean, the furnishings comfortable, inviting and there are touches of fun art pieces that adds to the overall charm. Wi-Fi easily accessed and functional, big screen TV and video games in the lower level. Laundry facilities, two full bathrooms.
I was pleasantly surprised over how the house was stocked with anything a renter could possibly want or need from birthday candles to books and games, tea and LaCroix, a solidly stocked kitchen allowing people to prepare any kind of dish imaginable if they want to cook.  Restaurants in the neighborhood you can walk to.
W

name: Safe neighborhood, cute 1920’s w/ backyard
description: This 3 bedroom, 1 bath, family-friendly home is located in St Paul's Como Park neighborhood. The house is centrally located on a quiet street less than 1/2 mile from Lake Como, Como Park and Zoo. The home features a fenced in back yard, patio, grill, central heating and air, linens, towels, dishes, etc. to make your stay comfortable. Your host is Karina, a nurse at a local hospital who lived in the home until 2018. Communication is prompt and personal, unlike many of the portfolio-owned rentals.

host.name: Karina
host.about:
Chelsea House was my first home purchase and I loved her too much to part ways. Now I enjoy making a safe and welcoming place for guests.

I’m also a nurse at a local hospital, enjoy traveling, and like to visit nearby Como Park in my free time. 

I love hearing from guests, so if you have a question send it on over!

amenities: Children’s books and toys for ages 0-2 years old, 2-5 years old, 5-10 years old, and 10+ years old

detailed_reviews.comments: Cozy, considerate, regularly maintained, faced no problems. Appreciate the stay!
Karina offers a cozy home which could have belonged to your grandparents.  Great Wifi and space for living/working in the Twin Cities. Lovely outdoor space also weather permitting.

Karina was an out of this world host, she was very understanding and accommodating. 
Her hospitality made my clients feel at home.  
Thank you Karina
Extremely quiet home in a good neighborhood worth the value. Would recommend this to anyone. Very respectful of privacy and space. Communication was amazing

Our family had a great stay at Karina’s house during our family visit. The house located in a nice neighborhood. People around here are so friendly, the neighbor even invited us to ice skating rink in his backyard. 
The location is great, near Como park, which is so beautiful even in Winter, very convenient for cross country skiing. Supermarkets and restaurants are close by, less than ten minutes walk. We will definitely come back here again.

Karina's place has so many more accommodations for a family with young kids than we anticipated. It was like being in a home and not just a hotel room. The neighborhood was extremely quiet and Karina was quick to respond to any questions we had. We stayed for 5 weeks and loved every bit of it!

Karina was a wonderful host, very responsive. We had everything we needed in the kitchen, comfortable beds, and she set out books and a little table for my kids so they had a great little play area. The location is just blocks from Como Park and the neighbors were all super nice. Would definitely stay again!

My family of 6 have amazing memories of our month long stay here! We were able to walk to Como Zoo, park and lake almost every day. The outside patio was also a go to spot. The kitchen and laundry made it possible to feel at home.
There is a reason why Karina is a super host. She's so wonderful to work with! Her place was clean and adorable. It's a fantastic location!!!

This cozy little home by como was a nice place to stay while we transitioned between houses. The neighborhood is friendly and quiet and close to everything we needed.
The host was awesome and very responsive. She helped us when we needed it and felt like she cared about our family.
The only downside is that because we stayed for almost 2 months, there wasn’t much space for all of our clothes. There weren’t any dressers, just closets, so that’s something to consider if you need extra clothes space.
Otherwise, everything was just what we needed, and more! We made good use of the yard games provided and the kids loved the bunk bed and piano as well.

The perfect size for my family of four during our month long stay. Anything we needed, Karina was on it! 
Would definitely recommend, especially for families with young kids - the bunk bed was a hit!

Karina's home was beautiful, easy to get in and out using a keypad which was nice so everyone didn't have to have a key. We were there over Christmas and New Years, and when we had 2 big snowstorms in a row. Karina was at the house early in the morning and had everything shoveled and made sure to text to let us know she was coming. We had a few questions and she was quick to respond and so, so friendly! We did get to meet the neighbors in the area due to the snowstorms as we all worked together to dig people out (all of the neighbors were warm and welcoming) and my sons helped clear the ends of the alley to make it easier for everyone to get in and out. 
We were able to explore the area try out new restaurants and stores. We had a great experience and it was a wonderful interim place between houses. I'm so happy we chose this home and you will be too! Thank you Karina!

Nice house, great patio, friendly neighbors, quiet and convenient neighborhood close to Como Park, the St Paul campus, and shopping. Karina was a friendly and accommodating host. We stayed seven weeks. I'd highly recommend this Airbnb.

Host was amazing. This house is beautiful and welcoming. If you are choosing an extended stay in the area I 100% recommend this home. If she wasn’t selling it our employees would always stay here when in town.

This was a very homey and convenient option for visiting family in Roseville.  Quiet neighborhood that was also walkable to major stores.  Some cute outside space that we did not utilize because of the season, but I would imagine are great in warmer weather.
I stayed in this cute house for nearly 4 weeks and felt right at home.  Host was friendly, responsive, and helpful.  I'd stay here again and would recommend to a friend.

We stayed for a month this summer after staying for two months the previous summer. It's a great location very near to Como Park, golf course, zoo, and conservatory. Very bikeable and walkable. This is a quiet residential neighborhood and felt quite safe. There are plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby. It's about 15 minutes from the U of M and 20 minutes from either downtown. There is a nice shaded lawn and patio. There is an elementary school with a good playground a block away, and a welcoming Lutheran church two blocks away. 
There is a washer and dryer which we found very helpful. We also had use of the garage for our car and bike.  
The kitchen was well-equipped and Karina generously left us some food which was very welcome since we arrived quite late the first night. Karina was very responsive to all our needs. 
We were very happy with both our stays and would highly recommend this Airbnb.
Excellent house in a beautiful neighborhood! Karina was extremely responsive and helpful.

Wholeheartedly recommend Karina’s place. Cozy house, walkable area, friendly neighbors. The house has everything you need for a comfortable stay. The children’s room with bunkbeds, books and a little desk was a hit with our kids.

This was a small but lovely space. Karina was very responsive to questions. Easy to access the space through coded door lock. We stayed there a week while visiting family in the area, to have a separate space to cook and sleep. Convenient location for shopping, meals and walking the neighborhood.

name: Historic Home | 3 BR | Parking | Monthly Discounts
description:
Your comfortable, spacious home awaits! Built in 1911, the space offers old world charm with modern amenities, including fast, reliable internet if you're working from home. Enjoy the private, fenced backyard and covered front porch during the glorious warmer months in MN!

Located within minutes walk of Regions Hospital, the Capitol Mall, and beautiful Summit Avenue, you can also hop on the freeway quickly to experience all the Twin Cities offers!

Ask about multi-month discounts!

neighbourhood.overview:
Saint Paul is home to a rich and diverse history and people and currently houses a vast number of parks, gourmet and ethnic restaurants, microbreweries, museums, historic buildings, live music venues, and more. 

Our home is tucked in a quiet neighborhood behind the Capitol, close to all the Saint Paul landmarks. You will have fast, easy access to public transportation and freeways to get you to the other wonderful places in the Twin Cities/Metro area.

Specifically:
0.3mi to the State Capitol Building and it's amazing mall/gardens
0.3mi to Regions Hospital
0.3mi to the nearest Green Line Light Rail Station
0.6mi to Lunds&Byerlys (Grocery)
1.0mi to the Cathedral of Saint Paul and Summit Ave
1.1mi to CHS Field
1.2mi to the Xcel Energy Center
1.2mi to Farmer's Market
... and more!

host.name: Richard
host.about: We started hosting in 2016 - seven years and three kids later we still love hosting! We are thrilled to be able to provide a space for people to feel at home in the city and state we adore. As a family we love exploring Minnesota's great outdoors, travelling, reading, and making food. We thrive on exploring new cultures and cuisines and meeting new people. We are excited for the opportunity to host you!

amenities: Clothing storage: walk-in closet, closet, wardrobe, and dresser
Children’s books and toys for ages 0-2 years old and 2-5 years old
Bose sound system with Bluetooth and aux
Free driveway parking on premises – 6 spaces

detailed_reviews.comments:
Hannah and Richard are fantastic as hosts! They are young, dynamic, and enthusiastic about the Twin Cities. They were very communicative before arrival. 
Their place is very nice, and has character. The neighbourhood is quiet, but quite central. 
They have a piano and loads of political philosophy books if you want to revisit your undergrad days. 
Would stay with again.

Hannah and Richard were amazing hosts! This was our first time using Airbnb, and we could not have asked for a better experience. They were very welcoming, and very prepared for accommodating guests. We were in Saint Paul for a concert, and when we realized last minute that we needed to print off our tickets they went above and beyond to help us. Although we declined, they offered us both dinner once we arrived at their home and breakfast before we left in the morning. They were also eager to give us tips for restaurants and directions to our concert venue. 
Their house is amazing! It is clear they've put a ton of work into making it their home. The decor was very on trend, and made their home even more lovely. Not to mention, it was spotless. Due to some repainting in their guest room, we had to stay in a different room, which they gave us at a discounted rate, but it was honestly worth the original rate- if not more! It's also in a great location- we were able to walk to the concert venue, which was at the Xcel Energy Center. It's also a very short walk to the Green Line, which runs all throughout Saint Paul.

as a first time airbnb user, i could not have asked for a better experience.  hannah & richard were quick to respond to all of my questions prior to my arrival & provided some excellent suggestions for my visit to the twin cities.  their neighborhood was very nice & quiet w/ little noise from the city even though it is so close to the capital building (& light rail station/public transportation) - i was in town for an event at the xcel center & was easily able to walk to & from their house.  also, i was able to take advantage of a small, quiet park one block away with a nice gazebo, benches, public garden & misc art sculptures.  their home is very nice nice & clean w/ a large kitchen that includes well stocked tea area & a smaller refrigerator dedicated to guest use - they also stocked it w/ a couple waters & a much appreciated can of coke!  i also saw some snacks & was offered some breakfast items but declined.  there was a small tv room near the guest bedroom stocked w/ games & books & the bathroom was roomy & very well appointed.  while there was no air conditioning, i found the ceiling fan in the bedroom to be more than adequate & actually preferable to ac - the room was very nicely decorated w/ a sitting chair & lamp, dresser & closet space, alarm clock, emergency info (thnx!) & a nice selection of books.  to sum up; great location/hood, great room/home & great hosts - thanks very much.

Richard and Hannah were incredibly hospitable hosts! They were more than happy to work with our schedule, as far as checking in and out. They were also able to accommodate some extra requests (e.g., providing an extra air mattress for the guest room) and gave us some ideas for fun activities in the area. Not to mention, their house was absolutely gorgeous and conveniently located! I would recommend them highly, to anyone who is staying in the Twin Cities area!

FANTASTIC PLACE TO STAY!!!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!! I stayed one night with at Hannah and Richard's beautiful home in St. Paul. This couple is extremely generous and warm. I was very touched by all the little details of my stay. I felt like I was at a Bed and Breakfast. The room I  stayed in was very cozy and clean. My towels were carefully folded in a basket with ribbon... like they were a present waiting for me. They even have an automatic water heater and assorted teas to chose from in the bedroom. There is a wide driveway in which  to park your vehicle. Hannah even made me coffee and offered me cereal and a banana when I woke up in the morning! These two are so welcoming, I felt right at home.

Hannah and Richard are very welcoming, and wonderful hosts. They always respond quickly whether you text them before you get there or if you need anything when you are there (and they are out and about).
There have a driveway where you can park off street, and you can even see your car from your bedroom window.
Their home is a few minutes walk from the light rail and bus stops.
I stayed for a week, and every day was a pleasure to be there in their gorgeous home. 
Every room is clean and nicely furnished. The large kitchen is modern. Plus they have a mini fridge (in the kitchen) just for you. It is stocked with bottled water, soda, eggs and cereal, plus plenty of space for your items that need to be refrigerated. 
It is a little steep going up and down the stairs to the 2nd floor. But that little effort is definitely worth reaching the spacious bedroom upstairs. It has a large closet, a comfy chair, a dresser, and next to the very comfortable bed is a neatly lettered large card with their wifi and emergency info plus each of their phone numbers. The ceiling fan in the bedroom is great when it gets warm (there is no air conditioning), and there are two other fans available, too (a little portable fan and a window box fan). Lots of good books to read, too!
In the basement, there is a washer, dryer and full refrigerator (with freezer) for you to use.

Hannah and Richard are truly super hosts.  They put a lot of care and preparation into their house -- fine details such as a basket with towels and toiletries, a separate fridge with beverages and breakfast for the guests, and an information card with all of the pertinent details.  The house and lot are beautiful, veryclean and extremely well maintained.  They expressed genuine interest in me and it was great to get to know them.  Access to great St. Paul point of interest is a stone's throw away and they are very helpful with recommendations.

Richard and Hannah were great hosts, friendly and helpful, who generously shared their home, even some fresh fruit and whipped cream with me. The house is close to downtown for those who walk and take bus or light rail. Neighborhood restaurants and grocery stores (Lunds & Lunberg) were fun too! I took advantage of room fans and good weather to sleep well two nights.

Hannah and Richard were so welcoming and a great first Airbnb experience! Their place is just as described, and they had great suggestions on things to do nearby! We were in town for a wedding and are so happy we stayed here. Compared to our friends who stayed downtown in hotels, we were in a better neighborhood, with more things to do. Hannah & Richard were great hosts!

Hi Hannah & Richard! We had a splendid stay with you, thanks for everything! We enjoyed the conversation over tea & coffee, and also being able to use a great kitchen after some time car camping. The guest fridge is an especially nice feature which we put to good use. Love the space, artwork, and the occasional subtle sci-fi references.

For potential guests, we enjoy a walkable location and made use of the home's closeness to downtown St. Paul as well as the metro, which we took to Minneapolis for a day of exploring ($2.25 for a 2.5hr pass). Check-in was well coordinated and we met in person for the key handoff. Hannah & Richard are very personable hosts, and highly recommended. Enjoy!

SO much more than the listing. Richard and Hannah are kind, warm, accommodating hosts with a beautiful home we were lucky enough to share for a weekend. We'll definitely book them again next time we're in the area.  Thanks guys!

The hosts were great at communication before we arrived, and waited to welcome us into their home even though we were late and they had dinner plans!
