Eliza provided all the necessities and several extras in the apt. For our 5 nights we were comfortable, close to downtown and parking was easy. We would recommend the apt to others. Thanks Eliza!

Eliza's place was in an upscale and quiet neighborhood. It was within walking distance to the Walker art museum and sculpture park. You could even walk downtown from there if you chose. Her place was clean and as advertised. We enjoyed our stay.
Great neighborhood.  Close to downtown and highways.  Wonderful apartment.

My family stayed in Eliza's duplex for 5 nights while in town visiting family over Halloween weekend.  It was a great spot for us and worked out perfectly.  One of the days we walked to the Walker Art Center and enjoyed some time looking at the exhibits.  For the rest of our stay, it was a convenient location to get to our families' homes.

The home is exactly as pictured.  The weather outside was cold for us (from LA) but inside the home was nice and comfortable.  I had been wondering about this when we arrived since it's an older home, but it was truly fine.

I would recommend this space to anyone else needing a home base in Minneapolis.

Very comfortable.   Pleasant and convenient location.   One small full bathroom and 3 bedrooms.   Charming older building.   Stairway ascent required to second floor location.  Large living room and a dining room.  Full kitchen with functioning appliances.  Free parking was available in back but on-street readily available and more convenient.
Great historic apartment in great location! This apartment was perfect for our family of 5. We loved the cozy living room and modern kitchen. Great amenities. Eliza is a wonderful host.
Eliza was very responsive. She was especially accommodating when we required a late check-in. The apartment is very spacious.

Eliza was great!  Made us feel welcome and was available to answer questions. 
The house was great as well. We really enjoyed the space though the snowy winter day would have been further enhanced by some crackling logs in fireplace. 
The location was very. Convenient to the Walker, where we were attending a performance, as well as to park spaces, good restaurants, coffee shops, grocery, etc.  it was quiet with easy access to major thoroughfares.  I'd stay here again.
This was such a great place and a wonderful alternative to staying in a hotel. Eliza gave us a tour at the start, and everything was clean and comfortable. Highly recommended.
The apartment was great and perfect for a girl's weekend!  Very spacious, clean, and comfortable.  Eliza was great to work with and very responsive.

This apartment is in an excellent location, very pretty area surrounded by a beautiful park, yet walking distance to downtown and close to the U! Eliza was very accommodating, easy in and easy out.  We were very comfortable with our family of five, plenty of room to spread out.

This is a great place / charming, steps from the Walker Art Center, beautiful running and bike trails (you can rent a bike at the Walker). Super comfortable, affordable and well located. Highly recommended!
Thanks for the stay. We had a great trip

Eliza’s apartment is fantastic: roomy, clean, and comfortable.  The modern kitchen is roomy and easy to work in.  In short, the description in the posting is right on.  The location is outstanding.  It is near the Walker, across from a main east/west bike trail, and two miles from downtown.  Groceries, coffee shops and interesting neighborhoods are all very close. Eliza and her husband were ready to answer questions and provide any help that was needed.  Parking behind the building was a snap.

Our group of 3 stayed here for a business trip to 
Target HQ. Great location downtown and we were within minutes from where we needed to be the next morning. Eliza was accommodating our evening arrival and check-in booklet was a great help in getting us the details about the unit. Beds were comfortable and each bedroom had a working window AC unit. It is an upstairs unit with a separate entrance and stairs. There is only one bathroom, so be mindful of this if you have a larger group staying. With 3 women, we had to strategically plan our bathroom time in the morning. We wished we had more time to enjoy the unit and the area, would definitely stay there again.
We had a great experience at Eliza's apartment in Minneapolis. It was just as it looked in the photos, very spacious and comfortable for 4 adults.

The area was lovely, near the sculpture garden. The kitchen was very workable. Eliza was helpful prior to our visit,  and worked with us and airbnb to resolve the bed issue. The downsides for us, However the beds were not good for us, and we had to ask for a resolution, which Eliza provided after discussion with airbnb. The apartment floors are sloped which was a problem for me and anyone with mobility challenges needs to know before renting this apartment. The laundry is down in the basement which has a staircase landing that is coming away from the floor and to us didn't seem very safe at all. The apartment door lock is difficult to get the key in. Felt sorry for the downstairs guests as the floors creaked quite a bit. The open fireplace is lovely but not useable as it is sealed. Overall the apartment was large.  The Netflix on the Apple TV was a godsend for my husband who had all day to fill in while I was training.

Eliza's home was perfect for our 3 night visit to Minneapolis.  The location is fantastic! If your planning on being in town this is the place to get. The home itself is beautiful. It's an older Victorian style home wood floors high ceilings with beams and radiator heating. The kitchen is modern and has been updated.  The bedrooms are large and the beds very comfortable. Eliza has lots of pillows and towels for guests with huge closets in bedrooms for guests to unpack. The place was very spacious and comfortable for myself and my two adult children traveling with me.  I would recommend Eliza's beautiful home and would definitely stay there again when traveling to Minneapolis

We enjoyed the lovely home and found everything to be clean and comfortable. It was as described and the location was great!  As we were a group of six, it was nice to have a large living room and dining room.  We would definitely recommend this listing as an overall great place to stay.

I never met Eliza but she was very communicative and everything was as advertised. She is a communicative host with a great home. It's a beautiful walk to the nearby sculpture garden and park (designed by Olmstead). The home is large/spacious for 3-4 people, and my colleagues and I had a great time staying there for our conference downtown. I could also see this unit being very accommodating for a small family of 4-6 people. Thank you Eliza! It was so nice to be in Minneapolis during the fall (leaves are changing!)

The apartment was exactly what we hoped - very comfortable.  Lovely neighborhood with parks and walking distance to the Walker Museum and sculpture garden and public transportation.  The beds were very comfortable and had nice linens which we appreciate.

The instructions were simple, direct and clear - where to find the lock box and key and where to leave them when we left.
Great location. Very easy access. Our work week in Minneapolis was so much more comfortable because we had our "home", complete with chandelier and good WiFi.

Eliza was a great host, good communication, and helpful with all the things to do in Minneapolis. The beautiful apartment is great, super-convenient to downtown, the Walker, greenway, etc, but on a quiet street. Highly recommend staying here.

The apartment was exactly what we needed. The location really could not be beat -- running/biking trails begin on the other side of the road yet there is very easy access to highways and the Walker Art Center/sculpture garden just a short 5 minute walk away. It is evident that this is a rental apartment, personal touches are not its specialty, but that way the rules of rental are very clear and laid out, and the amenities it provides are nonetheless very comfortable. We had an issue with a blocked toilet, Eliza was quick to respond and sent a repairman to fix it even though it was New Year's Day.

Our stay in Eliza's home was nice. Clean and comfortable beds. 
There is Apple TV in the living room which was nice for us to watch a movie. Overall great experience.
Easy instructions. Very clean and friendly neighborhood. Great place!
Awesome. Place was much bigger than we expected and easily slept our bridal party. Parking was easy and easy access around.

Airbnb review Minneapolis
Everything went well. I would reccomend paying the $180.00 for this place if you need 2 or 3 bedrooms, and you want to be able to walk a half mile or so into downtown.
The photos are accurate, and at the same time the photos somehow depict it to be a modern, and a romantic place to come to. But actually it is a very old building and a bit worn. The inside is clean, very spacious and functional.
The kitchen is good and newly remodeled. One of the beds was comfortable, the other one was questionable.
Yes I would stay here again if I needed 2 or 3 bedrooms. But wouldn't come back and pay $180 as a romantic getaway type place.
Very comfortable apartment in great proximity to downtown Minneapolis

This is a beautiful home in a wonderful neighborhood.  The photographs accurately reflect the home and its features.  There is ample parking in back and on the street in front.  Eliza was responsive throughout, though there was really little need to connect as everything went so smoothly.  Would love the opportunity to stay here again in the future.

Eliza is great! Always responds quickly and is easy to work with. The house is in a perfect location to walk to city. Close to cool restaurants and bars and 0.5 miles to a nice brewery! Perfect house for a family or a group of friends! Everything you need is right there! Will for sure book with Eliza again!

We had a wonderful experience staying at this apartment. It was a perfect location and exactly as described. Communication with Eliza was quick and easy. I would definitely recommend staying at this property!

Great spacious and comfortable apartment.  Nice quiet neighborhood.  Owner was very responsive when we had a question about the stove and when we booked this place.  Loved the Apple TV which added to the relaxation time after a full day of sightseeing and shopping.  Location was very central and easy access to everything.  We would stay here again.

Eliza's place is fantastic in every way - location, space, accommodations, etc.  If the reason you love AirBNB is because it lets you live like a local, this place is your kind of place. Walking in, you instantly feel at home with wonderful space and everything you need. When preparing a conference dinner I was holding at the apartment, she was able to help with what I needed immediately. If you want to go for a morning run/walk/bike, there is a wooded trail right outside the door.  If you are heading downtown, it's a lovely walk through Loring Park, and all other neighborhoods feel very accessible with little confusion (even with the construction at the Walker). I cannot recommend the apartment or Eliza highly enough.
Beautiful place. Easy check in. We had a good time staying here with our two kids. Nice little things for kids like a stroller and some games. Really nice TV. Easy parking

Had a great stay at Eliza's this week, place was clean, well situated (construction is rough in the streets nearby) in a nice neighbourhood.
Her instructions are clear and helps seems readily available. I recommend and would come back anytime.
Eliza's house was very nice and spacious,  it was just perfect for our family of 4. The neighborhood was nice and quiet. Hopefully we'll be back next year!

The place is exactly as described.   It worked out great for us.   There is a lot of road construction in the area but it is far enough away to only be a bit of a traffic (not noise) issue.   I recommend this AirBnB highly!

This is great location for anything in the downtown Minneapolis area. Will be even nicer when the construction in this area is finished. 
The place is nice, with great charm and character. It is starting to get beat up a bit in places- most noticeably in the kitchen and bathroom. Eliza was very attentive to our needs and was a pleasure to work with.
Eliza was a responsive host and this was a great place to stay.  As our first Airbnb experience, this has set the bar pretty high for all future trips.
Great place within walking distance of downtown, and close to beautiful lakes.
Large living, dining, kitchen, good water pressure, floors are a bit squeaky but if that's the biggest problem you're doing pretty well. Two blocks from the Walker which was great.

Great place in a beautiful neighborhood. Easy access to freeway and 2 miles to DT. 7 dollar uber to the Usbank stadium. Place is clean and cozy. Beds were very comfortable. Awesome alternative to a hotel DT. Lots of space!
We greatly enjoyed our stay here. It was a warm on the coldest of minnesota days. It was easy to feel at home and a great place for a group of people.
Place with character which is as advertised.

This place is really nice. It is a 3BR with 2 doubles/Queens, and one room with twin beds. Having only one bathroom is the only drawback. Great kitchen we used for every meal. It has a nice dining room, and a very comfortable living room with leather sofas, chairs and a Roku for entertainment. We would absolutely stay here again.
We really enjoyed staying in this spacious and comfortable apartment - really lovely.  And wonderful "customer service".  Highly recommended.
Wonderful place!!!!  Couldn't have asked for a nicer Air B&B experience!  Clean and very spacious.  Great location!  Highly recommend!
Great place to stay!
great place!
good place

Close to downtown and buses, about 20 min biking to the U of M. Super nice parks and lakes in the neighborhood, perfect for walking or running. Quiet and safe area. Eliza was always a quick responder and took care of any problems we had during our stay. Thank you!

This is a lovely flat with great historic details. It is in a very nice neighborhood within walking distance of the Walker Sculpture Garden and Museum, and twenty minutes from the airport and MN Wildlife Refuge Center.
Amazing place. Short Uber ride to everywhere. Amazing. I would definitely book this place again and again!!
Very nice place. Owner was nice and easily accessible.

Three good size bedrooms with comfortable beds so it worked for my family of four. The place had nice character but the kitchen and bathroom are in need of a good cleaning. (The bathroom drain is still slow.) Also there were several light bulbs that needed to be changed. Eliza responded to my texts about other small items but she never fixed the lights. 
The location was good: quiet & safe.  We parked right in front. It was an easy walk to the Walker Museum. Good food coop and restaurants near by.

Eliza did fix the slow drain and replace the light bulbs at the end of our 1 st week as requested( previous reviewer had also made note of that).   The location is fabulous but as others have noted this is an old house that has been lived in so it is not in perfect condition. The laundry downstairs is not ideal as it is in a very old, damp unfinished basement. But the place has 3 bedrooms in an ideal location that worked for us for 2 weeks.

Eliza's place is exactly as it says. My bed was crazy comfortable. If I could have put it in my suitcase I would have stolen it. Eliza was VERY available and the place was perfect for our small group.
Beautiful classic Minneapolis apartment, wonderful location in a quiet neighborhood a short walk fro Walker Art Center.

This apartment is really spacious and great.  It is not as bright as the pics but if is SUPER comfortable and a wonderful place to stay.  Eliza is very available if anything need attention.  Would stay here again.

We have a family of five and the rental was perfect. We were able to cook our own meals and the bike trail was right across the street. The sculpture garden down the block is a great place for an early morning walk or to catch the city skylight light up at sunset. We highly recommend this site.

Eliza's place is in a great location and the space itself is lovely. My husband and I were escaping Hurricane Irma and came to MN to see family. Of course we couldn't leave our two dogs and Eliza was very gracious to accommodate us even though she normally doesn't allow pets. We really appreciated it!
Her cohost was excellent and communicated quickly the entire time. The bathroom was not the cleanest (which happens from time to time especially because Eliza was out of town and it's not always possible to check the cleaner) but Jason (cohost) came right after we mentioned it and cleaned it personally.
We really looked forward to using the fireplace but when we got there it was decorative use only. That was a disappointment but I believe she changed the listing to reflect this and be more clear. Overall we would definitely recommend staying here!
We had a great stay!  House is in a quiet area near a cool sculpture garden and right close to down town!
Nice, big space. Very responsive.

Hosts are very accommodating and responsive. The place was very clean and organized. The whole process from beginning to end was simple and organized as well. Would definitely reserve with them again when I visit the area.
Great place! Stayed a pretty long time and cant think of any complaints! Would highly recommend to any one !!
Great location

I was in on business and brought my wife along.  We had a great stay and enjoyed the apt. location.  Lots of close activities to engage in including a walk into the city for a date night!! Great response time and consideration given when requested. Would stay again for sure.  Thank you !!
Excellent spot! Perfect as our home away from home during a remodel. Very central location. Outstanding communication and hospitality.

This home is in a great location close to the center of Minneapolis, yet a quiet, older neighborhood of classic homes.  It has plenty of space for a group to spread out in and be comfortable and is furnished very comfortably.  We would definitely stay here again!

large and open apartment in a two unit, two floor duplex. it is overall a pretty space in an excellent location. it is a gorgeous neighborhood that is close enough to Uptown for a good walk but not so close as to make street parking difficult. there are lots of stairs and the laundry is in the basement. so folks with mobility challenges won't want to stay here. AC in bedrooms works great, but stand-alone AC unit in living room does not sufficiently cool down common areas. the AC helps for sure, but if you're heat sensitive it's best not to stay here in very warm weather.
Great quiet location walking distance to sculpture garden, lots of space, very comfortable beds, plenty of parking, nice amenities, communication was very smooth.
Loved the space and the location. Very easy check in and great amenities.

This place is Huge and convenient to downtown and uptown. A few steps from the famous Cherry on the Spoon and the sculpture garden and Walker Art Museum that accompanies it. A bit hard to find for cabbies, but the neighborhood is very quiet and a great place to crash after a long day of exploring all that the Twin Cities has to offer!

Lovely and spacious apartment in a gorgeous, quiet neighborhood close to downtown.  The beds were super comfortable and bathroom stocked with shampoo and everything you need.  Would definitely stay here again.
We a cool stay, cheers
Gorgeous apartment, near everything with views of the skyline and a short walk from the lakes. Fantastic
Great place in a rich neighborhood just on the outskirts of downtown. It's large and clean!

We spent 2.5 months here between homes. We had our 1 year old there and as a stay-at-home parent during this snowy Winter, this was a very comfortable place to be. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've slept on. The Roku was really helpful on the long days inside. Aaron was always super responsive and helpful.
I definitely would recommend this to friends and family.
Small single bath, hot water very limited; downstairs of duplex noisy; would never stay again
Great place! Very spacious!
Nice place in beautiful, quiet neighborhood

A large, beautiful space with lots of room for the entire family. I was disappointed with the cleanliness; lots of dust, dirty microwave, crumbs on kitchen floor, etc. I wrote the manager and he had someone come clean up while we were out the second day of our stay which made a big improvement but it could still use a deep clean. The beds were comfortable and it was quiet so we slept well.

This apartment was easy to find and in quiet, low traffic neighborhood convenient to the art museum and sculpture garden.  Check in was a breeze, and the apartment was enormous.  We had so much room to stretch out and get cozy.  The wind in the trees outside the windows made dusk very beautiful.  The kitchen was well appointed with everything we needed to snack and prepare light meals.  The space is distinctive and a nice break from traveling.

This is a really nice unit. Location is near downtown, uptown and the walker sculpture garden. All are walkable. Host is responsive and helpful. The kitchen has everything you need to make a nice meal at home and there is plenty of nightlife restaurants and bars nearby. 10/10 would stay again.
Great stay and a great location next to the sculpture garden. My one gripe is how hot and humid the place got in the summer, though that isn't totally the hosts fault.

Lovely well located flat! An easy 15min walk (through a park) to the city centre. Aaron was very accommodating re us bringing a small baby & when the internet went down contacted us to resolve the issue immediately!

Great location and size of space.  Loved having off street parking and laundry onsite.  Loved being able to walk and bike everywhere.  With just a little effort, and not much money, this place could be awesome.  As mentioned by a few others, it really needs a deep cleaning!!  Please get the windows and the kitchen cleaned, especially.
Great location, very comfortable space, small lake/pond across the street.

Great location--next to the spectacular Lowry Hill neighborhood. Easy access to parks. You must eat brunch at the Kenwood Restaurant (walking distance)--I didn't know eggs could be so light and fluffy (French style omelets). The author Louise Erdrich owns a bookstore in Lowry Hill, next to the Kenwood--Birch Bark Books--a must visit.  Apartment itself needs a thorough cleaning and a bit of updating. However, the living room with its large windows is wonderful.

Great location, GREAT amount of space to be.  We had an amazing time on our business retreat.  We had everything we needed from, kitchen supplies, to toiletries, to very fast communication with the owners.  The amazingly fast delivery services for just about anything, was a huge bonus!   It was a great trip.
Great space, especially for the price.  10 min drive to downtown
We had a great family weekend in Minneapolis while staying here.  It was a great location and the hosts were very easy to work with.
This is a very large space for multiple guests to share and feel they can have room to move.  Close to everything one would need.

Such a beautiful place. Great location very close to everything. Awesome neighborhood and parks right next door. Love that the old charm of this place is still intact. Would definitely love to stay here again.

Wonderful place - I stayed here for 3 months and was really sad to leave it. Close to beautiful running/bike paths, lakes, and parks. The apartment itself is super spacious (even more than the pictures show!), and it had everything I needed. Aaron (apartment host) was incredibly friendly and responsive. So grateful to have been able to make this place home for a few months!

The apartment is spacious and has all the amenities for an extended stay.  The location is excellent with close proximity to the Sculpture Garden and the lakes.  Markets are also just a short drive away.  Really enjoyed staying at this apartment.
Great spot for a longer stay. Spent 5 weeks there, very roomy and beautiful space, close to everything in Minneapolis. Quiet, good WiFi speed for working at home.

Location is excellent. Took regular walks to the sculpture garden. Easy access to downtown and freeways. Apartment was very comfortable. Would definitely stay there again. Hosts were very nice and responsive.

Beautiful neighborhood to walk around. Short walking distance to a few nice places but far from restaurants and supermarkets. Quite noisy due to the proximity to freeways. Very poor air conditioning and lack cleanliness.

My family was in town to visit our son and this was a great place to spend the week. The sculpture garden is a fun walk and everything else is a quick drive. The apartment is good, could use a deep professional clean and a new couch, but was overall a good value. There is no central air, but the portable and window units did cool it down despite the 90 plus degree days we were here. We would recommend this airbnb to anyone looking for a reasonably priced home base for a week.
Spacious and elegant, this upstairs apartment is in a perfect location for exploring Minneapolis.  Highly recommended.
Loved the apartment. It is in a perfect spot and was everything we could ask for. Hope to stay here again.
Thank you!
Location, location, location. The house was so perfectly located that we felt like we had Minneapolis at our fingertips. We had a great time during our stay.
We stayed for few days and we are really liked,  and I would recommend it.
Great location and was a very good size!

We really enjoyed our stay at this Lovely 3BD apartment.  It is a very nice converted older home in a great location for accessing multiple areas of Minneapolis.  We were in town for a Twins baseball game and found the ballpark easy to access from here.  The beds are very comfortable and it is a spacious setting.  The only thing to make note of is that the stairs leading up to the apartment are a little steep, so if someone has mobility issues, that may be a concern, otherwise they shouldn't be a problem.  Eliza and her co-host Aaron were great with communication and kind enough to make some recommendations on breweries and restaurants in the area.  They even provide a nice little packet on the coffee table with some local recommendations.  Highly recommend considering this location if your going to be in the area.

Eliza and Aaron's AirBnB was a wonderful place to stay for five of us.  So much space and it is across the street from Sculpture park and the The Walker Art Museum.  We were visiting our son who lives in Minneapolis and another daughter and her boyfriend came up as well.  On Saturday we went to the Minnesota State Fair in St. Paul and the Twins/Brewers game at night at Target Field.  We had dinner Friday night at The French Meadow Restaurant and on Sunday went to Lagos Tacos for brunch after walking through Sculpture Park taking in the great art work.  Delicious food and always so many great restaurants in the Twin Cities to try.  So much fun and wonderful family memories were made.
Kindly,
Nancy & Dan Battist
Madison, WI
Excellent location in the heart of Minneapolis. Plenty of things to do and places to visit in the area. The walking distance the sculpture garden is a definite plus.

The house has so much character and is beautiful. The stairs up to the unit is very steep and we ran into a small issue with a few box elderbugs crawling around (no fault of the owners, just the season I believe). However location is perfect and parking in front made it even more convenient! The hosts had great communication and made everything very easy!

The house is cozy and had everything we need for a comfortable stay. The host was great on accommodating our stay. Excellent communication. If you’re cooking, you will need to get essentials like salt , pepper, sugar etc.
Eliza and Aaron are wonderful to work with - enjoyed our stay!

This is a gorgeous space with lots of room with many different seating options. A couple of chairs get great morning sun. I took over one corner for yoga. Washer and dryer is  convenient in the basement and no charge. Parking is very easy in this neighborhood with a spot almost always available right out in front. The location is ideal. Aaron was easy to contact and very responsive. We would definitely stay here again.
Charming home, perfect location.
Great location and smooth check-in and check out.
wonderful space, location and hosts!
Amazing stay. Loved the home! Hosts were amazing

Lots of old world charm in a great location - close to the sculpture garden, the Walker Art Center and access to I-94.  We enjoyed the large spaces for hanging out, as well as the  lovely dining room.
I absolutely loved this place! I stayed here for a month,  and enjoyed being so close the Sculpture Garden. I would stay here again.

The apartment was very charming. Large. However a lot of box elder bugs were in my room. Every morning there were at least 10 - 15 on the windows. Not sure where they go at night. And in the shower. Im a tent/car camper so im not really bothered by it. And they don't bite. We didn't use the TV to watch our movies, because the remote had battery acid leaking from the interior. We did our best not to be loud as we walked through the apartment, but its an older home from 1916 I believe, so impossible not to creek with most steps. The beds were very comfortable with plenty of pillows for me. I have back issues and slept great. The extra heavy blankets helped. The morning we left, the apartment didn't have power. So I'm glad my phone was charged. I heard a loud bang in the morning so maybe a transformer outside blew? I called a couple times before we left, but never had contact or was contacted. Great location near uptown, downtown and interstate entrance and exists, and a very nice, short walk to Walker art garden and museum. Hidden beach is not far at all and a nice drive to other lakes. Very beautiful homes in the neighborhood. We were pretty busy on our stay, so our time spent at the house was minimal during the day. We had one less adult with us than expected, so my daughter got the other queen bed. She was very comfortable. The bathroom was clean other than a few bugs. Plenty of hot water, as well as good water pressure. Shower guy. The kitchen, which we really didn't use, was also clean, not perfect , no complaints, but it could use a new microwave. Lots of light in the living areas, even though the apartment faces north. Avid readers, so that was nice. Had the place for 3 nights.
Did not interact with Eliza. Host Aaron was very helpful and communication was perfect. Stayed for a girls weekend and the apartment was exactly as advertised and what we needed.
Nice spacious apartment right by Walker Art Center.

Location, Location, and again Location!!
Older apartment filled with light and lots of room for several people.
This is a second floor apartment, so if you are older consider that reality.

second time staying with Eliza and just as perfect as the first time. located close to everything you'd want to do in Minneapolis, sculpture garden and Loring Park within Walking distance, downtown and bars just a short drive away. 
easy to check in and check out. 
just a great stay. 
thanks again.
Great, convenient stay!
Great place!
Was in a nice area. Had unfortunately a few bugs throughout the place, especially in the restroom. Overall, a good stay.

While overall Eliza and Aaron's apartment is livable, it lacks in several areas. The furniture, for the most part, is old and worn out. Cushions on the sofa and loveseat sag when sat on, and most of the end tables and bed stands are beat up and scarred. We had considerable trouble with the heat; the evening we arrived, the heat had not been turned up and the apartment temperature was in the 50's. It took several hours for the old warm water radiators to heat the place to a comfortable temperature. Using the laundry in the basement is an uncomfortable experience, as the stairway is dusty and cobwebbed, while the basement itself is cluttered, damp, poorly lit, and smelly.
The saving grace is the neighborhood, which is enchanting. Downtown Minneapolis is a pleasant walk away, and the Sculpture Garden is a beautiful place for a stroll.

We enjoyed the safe location and the delightful sculpture park across the street as we walked to downtown MSP for a conference.   Perfect Location.  Street Parking is the way to go, as there was always an easy parking space out front or on the side.   Enjoyed the comfortable couches in the living room for time to unwind from the day.    
Eliza was very communicative and always offered assistance if needed.

Booked with a full party of 6.  We arrived relatively late in the evening and had no trouble getting inside and settling in.  Aaron, Eliza's co-host, responded to the couple of messages we sent quickly and with detailed information.  Some of the appliances in the kitchen have a few quirks (the dishwasher door squeaks loudly, and it seems the stove's "lock" function is a bit finicky), but we had all the kitchen tools we needed to make what we had planned on.  The nearby park is great for walking, and Dunn Brother's Coffee was a great breakfast/lunch shop within walking distance.  All in all, it was a good place to call "home" for 5 days, and I'd be happy to stay there again.
Beautiful old home.  Plenty of room and great location
Great location, quick to respond, and flexible.  Would absolutely stay again.

Great space! We were in town for two nights and spent a good deal of time in between events and meals at the apartment. The living room area felt like our own classy hotel lobby with big comfy couches and armchairs. The neighborhood is also great, as we took walks to the lakes, the sculpture garden, coffee shops, and a nearby brewery. Would definitely stay again.
This was my second time at this house.Loved the place  and will come back again

name: 1 BedRm-Den/Office-Tap Stays Grand 3-Fast Wi-Fi
description:
➤ Modern 1 bedroom + den apartment  
➤ Fully stocked and equipped kitchen, Washer/Dryer in Apt.
➤ Keyless entry - Come and go as needed and with ease in Secure Building.
➤ Walk score of 79/100, Bike score of 84/100
➤ Extremely Fast Internet - 549 Mbps download and 606 upload speed
➤ Mall of America is a 8.3 mile drive
➤ MSP Airport is a 10 mile drive
➤ Convention Center is a 3 mile drive
➤ US Bank Stadium is a 4.4 mile drive

neighbourhood.overview:
*Please note there will be construction on the street in front of the building during summer 2022, and access on that side will be limited. The surrounding area does have plenty of parking available, but guests may need to walk a block or two*

☛ Restaurants: Nighthawks Diner & Bar, Our Kitchen, Pizza Luce Uptown, Victor's 1959 Cafe, Grand Cafe, Rincon 38, Blackbird, Gigi's Cafe, Bogart's Doughnut Co., Sonny's Ice Cream, Tap Society. Vo's Vietnamese Restaurant

☛ Shops: Present Moment Herbs & Books, Dave the Pie Guy, Sugar Sugar Candy, Kinoko Kids, Digs, Ja'Lisa's Gorgeous Extensions, Bower Boutique

♨ Coffee: Vicinity Coffee, Five Watt Coffee Kingfield, Royal Grounds Coffee, Steamship coffee & tea

♛ Entertainment: Pat's Tap: Skee-Ball, Driftwood: Local music, Uptown (1.5 miles), Lake Harriet Bandshell Park (2.2 miles), Lake Bde Maka Ska (1.6 miles), Lake of the Isles (3.5 miles), Cedar Lake (3.4 miles), Tangletown (2.3 miles), Mall of America (

host.name: Russell
host.about: I am committed to providing a comfortable and quality stay for all my guests and I would invite you to read my reviews. Tap Stays - A stay as comfortable as home.

amenities: Exercise equipment: free weights, yoga mat
Standalone high chair - always at the listing
55 inch HDTV with Roku, standard cable
Coffee maker: drip coffee maker, Keurig coffee machine
Pack ’n play/Travel crib - always at the listing

detailed_reviews.comments: Exceeded expectations, host was amazing and very helpful and considerate.  5 star rating all the way.
Great little place. Would stay again. Clean everything appeared new. Great management.
Great place. Everything is new. Will stay again.
Great location, great security for building. Host was very accommodating. Apartment has all necessary items and more. Parking is an added bonus! Will stay again when I’m the twin cities.
A+++ pristine, very clean, safe and communication. A must stay!! Every thing that you would need was taken care of.

I stayed at this place for a month and loved it throughout my stay. Very comfortable space with all amenities that one can possibly need for such a stay. Probably the best Airbnb I have stayed in a long time. Russell was very responsive. I would love to stay again if the need arises.

Russell & Family are the greatest hosts!!! ❤️ The property was exactly as described, very clean! Pets are allowed and have plenty of walking area! He makes sure everything is well stocked with everything you will need for a short or long stay! The TV's are even programmed to automatically sign you out of your accounts when you check out so you don't have to remember that on top of packing!! Anytime you need to contact him, you'll have a response within 30 mins or less! This is the 2nd property hosted by Mr. Russell I have stayed at (long stay) and if possible I will ALWAYS book with them!!! ❤️🥰 Oh! the beds are SUPER COMFORTABLE!! A huge plus!!! You will definitely love staying here!!! A++++++++❤️🐶❤️

This is my 2nd 'Russels Air B&B' I've stayed at!! His properties are A++++ and are very clean, well decorated, & well stocked!! He also lets you know ahead of time if there's any maintenance scheduled while your staying! Any concerns or questions, he will respond to you quickly☺️ Also,this area is a very neighborhood friendly place!! Dog friendly also🐕 Anytime I mite need to, I will definitely look for Mr. Russell's places 1st!! ❤️☺️🐶
Great place for short term living!

We had a lovely stay at Russell's and would definitely stay again. Everything was pristine and exactly as pictured (or better!) Communication was great, instructions clear and apt has everything you need to settle in - kitchen tools galore, cleaning supplies, trash bags, even spare batteries for remotes. 
Building is secure, well kept and parking spot is right by an entrance with a security camera. We had a snow storm during our stay and snow removal was fast. Bed was very comfortable - Mr.  likes soft, I like firm and we were both happy!
We both worked remote and can confirm WiFi is excellent. Office even has a whiteboard, pens and an electric sit stand desk! 
The only negative is totally out of Russell's control. The resident upstairs is a big guy with a firm footstep who must work from home. I'll be the first to admit I'm sensitive to neighbor noise and it didn't bug my hubby. But if you're sensitive you may hear him at all hours.
5 ⭐ stay! Highly recommend!!

I stayed here for a month. It was a very nice, very comfortable place to stay. The building was quiet. The pictures don't highlight it, but the den was perfect for working in, with a sitting/standing desk and plenty of space. The kitchen had everything that I needed. The neighborhood was beautiful, at least in the fall when I was there. I enjoyed walking down the streets. Lake Bde Maka Ska was within walking distance, and it is also beautiful. I'd definitely stay there again.
This apartment was clean  and comfortable and had everything we needed, in a neighborhood with lots of amentities (restaurants, shops, services, etc). Russell was very responsive and helpful.

“I had a fantastic experience staying was exactly as described—clean, comfortable, and well-equipped. The location was perfect was incredibly welcoming and responsive, making the check-in and stay seamless. I would highly recommend this stay to anyone visiting the area and would gladly return!”

I stayed at Russell's condo for two months. It was a great experience, as it was close to many amenities, and offered all I was looking for. He was super responsive. I would highly recommend staying at one of his properties. I would definitely stay here again, should I get the chance!!

name: Motel 6 Roseville, Mn - Minneapolis Nort
description: Motel 6 Roseville, Mn - Minneapolis Nort

name: Modern Studio in Walkable Neighborhood Near Xcel
description:
Explore the historic West 7th neighborhood from the comfort & convenience of this centrally-located private basement studio just south of downtown St. Paul and the Xcel Energy Center. Located just blocks from breweries, trendy restaurants, coffee shops, and more. Enjoy panoramic river and skyline views from the Smith Avenue Bridge across the street.

NOTE: The entrance is in our backyard and is on the basement level of our home. You will need to go down a set of 7 fairly narrow, steep steps.

neighbourhood.overview:
Located in the historic West 7th neighborhood just off the Smith Avenue Bridge, which offers panoramic views of the downtown skyline and the Mississippi River bluffs.

Less than 1 mile from the Xcel Energy Center, Palace Theater, Ordway, Landmark Center, and downtown St. Paul. Easily walkable to tons of local favorites including Hope Breakfast Bar, Cossetta's, Keg & Case, Mancini’s, four breweries, and more...  

United, Regions, and Children's Hospitals are 0.4 miles away.

Walkable to dozens of breweries, cocktail lounges, coffee shops, restaurants, live music bars, and other attractions. This area is very up and coming and has tons of unique, memorable experiences.

Waldmann & Bad Weather breweries are 1.5 blocks down the street. Claddaugh Coffee, Day by Day Café, and Emerald Lounge are 2 blocks away.

host.name: Kealani
host.about:
We are Kealani & Rudy, an easy-going, adventure-loving couple from Saint Paul. We love anything that gets us outside exploring whether that’s mountain biking, hiking, ice skating, or canoeing. 

We live with our cats in an old house in a historic neighborhood that we absolutely adore. We love playing games and drinking German or Belgian style beers… bonus points if we can do both things on a patio on a beautiful day. 

We are also a husband-wife wedding videography team. We love to explore different cultures & traditions, meet new people, and try new things!

amenities: 50 inch HDTV with Amazon Prime Video, Apple TV, Netflix

detailed_reviews.comments:
We feel so lucky to find this space!  It was warm and cozy, bedding was lovely and the bathroom had the amenities of a hotel.  Very quiet and a perfect getaway! 
Short Lyft ride to Rice Park/Excel Center (though walkable if you’re up for it). Loved the nearby breweries too. 
Super fast responses from the hosts- as well as checking in with us via the app to see how things were going. 
One of our best Airbnb stays!

TBH I’m not gone complain but ,I think this place is too cheap for how clean it is and how organized everything was. You guys definitely need to raise the price, don’t short yourselves because that’s definitely 5 star stay

There are so many great things about this Airbnb!  The location was really convenient with lots to do nearby. We visited a local brewery and went to an event at the Xcel Energy Center (it’s so close!)  Check-in was easy and the space was really comfortable.  The whole place was clean and my favorite part was the fancy shower!  We would recommend this Airbnb and hope to be back again.

A amazing stay! Kealani was a gracious host with a great space. Walked in and felt right at home. very clean an a amazing bathroom. well within walking distance of the Xcel energy center and many other attractions. Irvine park across the state street and a few breweries near by. am going to be renting again!!!

Kealani has a great gem of a place! It is very cozy and homey and they have everything you could need. It was super clean and the shower was an added bonus with the waterfall shower head. I would highly recommend this place and would stay here again in a heartbeat.
Very nice amenities everything is super nicely put together. The area is perfect also
This is a great place for one or two people to explore St. Paul. It is a quiet and great Airbnb with amazing hosts. I would recommend staying here if visiting the twin cities.

I am in love with this Air BnB. I cannot wait to book again. So modern and beautiful, everything was just perfect. I almost felt like I was at home here. Kealani did an amazing job renovating this space and the hard work paid off.
She was very responsive and helpful. She had recommendations for nearby restaurants  and bars. The place was very clean and accommodating.

Kealani was the perfect host! She was very responsive, easy to talk to, and even went above and beyond - providing me a ride to the airport in the middle of a blizzard! This is the definition of a home away from home. Everything you could possibly need with some really sweet and thoughtful touches. It was private, and perfectly priced. The shower is heaven! Great location! So many incredible local establishments in walking distance!
 Kealani was also very accommodating when I thought I left something behind. she was quick to respond and followed up. I felt cared for. I will absolutely be returning!

The stay at Kealani's was great! It was easy to find and walking distance from downtown. The amenities were a nice touch. It was obvious a lot of care was put into making this studio a comfy place to stay!

Kealani's place is wonderful. Easy check-in, great communication, very helpful, looks like new, very clean, quiet and more. Great, safe area of St Paul, lots to do nearby.  One note to folks- path between gate and entrance was icy/snowy, but that's winter in Minnesota. Just be mindful and use stepping stones provided.  Would absolutely stay again!
10/10 stay

Kealani and Rudy define "hospitality!" We were absolutely BLOWN AWAY by the care and consideration they put into hosting us; it went WAY beyond having a clean and comfortable space. We were treated as dear friends visiting from out of town; they went far above and beyond to assure our comfort, enjoyment, convenience, and ease, even to VOLUNTEER to come out in a snow storm at midnight to pick us up after our concert, knowing that the weather would create transportation issues downtown. 1000% recommended! ❤️
(And I'm going to need that cookie recipe!)
